David Brin ( born October 6 , 1950 ) is an American scientist and award-winning author of science fiction .
`` Temptation '' appeared in Robert Silverberg 's anthology Far Horizons : All New Tales from the Greatest Worlds of Science Fiction and is set after the events in the Infinity 's Shore .
Many of Brin 's `` original '' works ( works not set into pre-existing series or `` universes '' ) focus on the impact on human society of technology humankind develops for itself , a theme which commonly appears in contemporary North American science-fiction .
Tikkun Olam ( `` repairing the world '' , i.e. people have a duty to make the world a better place ) is originally a religious concept but David Brin , like many non-orthodox Jews , has adapted this into a secular notion of working to improve the human condition , to increase knowledge , and to prevent long-term evils .
Brin has confirmed that this notion in part underscores the notion of humans as `` caretakers '' of sentient-species-yet-to-be , as David Brin explains in a concluding note at the end of Startide Rising ; and it plays a key role in The Uplift War , where the Thennanin are converted from enemies to allies of the Terragens ( humans and other sapients that originated on Earth ) when they realize that making the world a better place and being good caretakers are core values of both civilizations .
Hercules: The Legendary Journeys was produced from 1995 , and was very loosely based on the tales of the classical Greek culture hero Heracles ( Hercules was his Roman analogue ) .
The show had a successful spin-off , , with which Hercules: The Legendary Journeys shared recurring characters such as Ares ( Kevin Smith ) , Autolycus ( Bruce Campbell ) , Salmoneus ( Robert Trebor ) , Aphrodite ( Alexandra Tydings ) , Deimos/Strife ( Joel Tobeck ) and Callisto ( Hudson Leick ) .
Andromeda (TV series) ( formally titled Gene Roddenberry 's Andromeda ) is a Canadian/American science fiction television series , based on unused material by the late Star Trek creator Gene Roddenberry , developed by Robert Hewitt Wolfe , and produced by Roddenberry 's widow , Majel Barrett .
Andromeda (TV series) was filmed in Vancouver , British Columbia , Canada , and produced by Tribune Entertainment and Fireworks Entertainment .
Andromeda (TV series) was distributed by Global TV ( Fireworks ' parent company ) in Canada and syndicated in the United States on WGN and other channels .
Andromeda (TV series) is one of two TV series ( to date ) based upon concepts Roddenberry had created as early as the 1960s and 1970s .
The name Dylan Hunt had also been used for the hero of two TV movie pilots Roddenberry had produced in the mid-1970s , Genesis II and Planet Earth , which had a similar premise .
`` Rev '' is short for Reverend ; although he is a Magog and thus violent by nature , he has discovered a non-violent , Taoist-like religious order called The Way and become a Wayist priest .
Slipstream is the primary mode of travel for ships in the Andromeda (TV series) universe , and the only known method of traveling faster than the speed of light .
Further , slipstream is a non-linear method of travel ; the best and swiftest way to get from Point A to Point B ( though Andromeda (TV series) might be in the same galaxy ) may very well involve hopping to another galaxy entirely .
Andromeda (TV series) was nominated for six Academy of Science Fiction , Fantasy & Horror Films , USA awards , five Chicago International Film Festival awards , eight Gemini Awards , fifteen Leo Awards , and five WorldFest Houston awards .
Andromeda (TV series) is a Canadian/American science fiction television series , based on unused material by the late Star Trek creator Gene Roddenberry , developed by Robert Hewitt Wolfe , and produced by Roddenberry 's widow , Majel Barrett .
Kevin Sorbo ( born September 24 , 1958 ) is an American actor best known for the roles of Hercules in , Captain Dylan Hunt in Andromeda and Kull in Kull the Conqueror .
Kevin Sorbo and Kevin Sorbo girlfriend claimed to have seen the ghost of the `` Bride of White Rock Lake '' - a woman who supposedly died on her wedding day , murdered by a former lover .
In 1997 , while on a publicity tour for Kull the Conqueror and between the 4th and 5th seasons of Hercules , Sorbo experienced an aneurysm in Kevin Sorbo shoulder , which led to three strokes , which Kevin Sorbo attributes to a chiropractic manipulation .
As a result , Kevin Sorbo was weakened for the next several years , a condition that Kevin Sorbo and the producers of Hercules kept secret from the public .
The strokes , said to have been triggered when a chiropractic manipulation released blood clots from an aneurysm in Kevin Sorbo shoulder , have left Kevin Sorbo with permanent 10 % vision loss , weakness , balance issues and migraines .
Poutine is a common Canadian dish ( originally from Quebec ) , made with french fries , topped with brown gravy and cheese curds .
Among Poutine various culinary senses , that of `` a dessert made from flour or bread crumbs '' most clearly shows this influence ; the word pouding , borrowed from the English pudding , is in fact a synonym in this sense .
The pejorative meaning `` fat person '' of poutine ( used especially in speaking of Poutine ) is believed to derive from the English pudding `` a person or thing resembling a pudding '' or `` stout , thick-set person '' .
In the county culture especially , a mixed fry can also come with cooked ground beef on top and is referred to as a hamburger mix , though this is less popular than a regular mix .
In Prince Edward Island , a common dish is `` Fries with the Works '' which is fries with ground beef and onions , topped with thick beef gravy and fresh green peas .
Disco Fries , also known as `` Elvis Fries , '' served in New Jersey and select New York City diners , are made with brown gravy , mozzarella , and heavier steak fries .
Poutine is common in chip shops , and other small , local fast food stores and consists of thick-cut chips , shredded cheddar cheese ( and sometimes a 50/50 mix of cheddar and mozzarella cheese ) , topped with thick gravy .
In the Netherlands , Poutine consists of french fries , shawarma meats or doner kebab , and grilled gouda cheese , topped with salad , garlic sauce and sambal .
Achillea millefolium , known commonly as yarrow or common yarrow , is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae .
Several , including ` Kelwayi ' , and ` Lansdorferglut ' have gained the Royal Horticultural Society 's Award of Garden Merit .
The many hybrids of this species designated Achillea x taygetea are useful garden subjects , including : ` Appleblossom ' , ` Fanal ' , ` Hoffnung ' , and ` Moonshine ' Achillea millefolium , Achillea millefolium , is considered an especially useful companion plant , repelling some insect pests while attracting good , predatory ones .
The dark blue essential oil , extracted by steam distillation of the flowers , is generally used as an anti-inflammatory or in chest rubs for colds and influenza .
Yarrow , Achillea millefolium and Achillea millefolium North American varieties , was used in traditional Native American herbal medicine by tribes across the continent .
Other plants with white flowers in large compound umbels may be confused with Achillea millefolium , these include : water parsnip -- Sium suave ( swamp parsnip ) ; western water hemlock -- Cicuta douglasii ( poison hemlock ) ; and spotted water hemlock -- Cicuta maculata ( spotted parsley , spotted cowbane ) .
In 1634 , Berkeley Plantation became part of the first eight shires of Virginia , as Charles City County , one of the oldest in the United States , and is located along Virginia State Route 5 , which runs parallel to the river 's northern borders past sites of many of the James River Plantations between the colonial capital city of Williamsburg ( now the site of Colonial Williamsburg ) and the capital of the Commonwealth of Virginia at Richmond .
Harrison 's son , Benjamin Harrison V , a signer of the American Declaration of Independence and a Governor of Virginia , was born at Berkeley Plantation , as was his son William Henry Harrison , a war hero in the Battle of Tippecanoe , governor of Indiana Territory , and ninth President of the United States .
His son , Malcolm Jamieson ( who bought out the interests of other heirs after John 's death ) , and Malcolm 's wife , Grace , restored the manor , which had been in deteriorating condition .
Low comedy , in association to comedy , is a dramatic or literary form of entertainment with no primary purpose but to create laughter by boasting , boisterous jokes , drunkenness , scolding , fighting , buffoonery and other riotous activity .
Over time as low comedy began to include lewd jokes and more physical comedy , more mainstream performers began to practice this type of comedy : stand-up comedians , musicals , etc.
This idea explains why low comedy is well known and popular today , because Low comedy is considered suitable for all individuals .
The Electoral ( Amendment ) Act 2009 defines the County Waterford constituency as `` The county of Waterford , except the part thereof which is comprised in the constituency of Tipperary South ; and the city of County Waterford '' '' .
This is both a means of communication to signal possession of territory to Picinae rivals , and a method of locating and accessing insect larvae found under the bark or in long winding tunnels in the tree or upright log .
Strong neck and tail-feather muscles , and a chisel-like bill are other hammering adaptations which are seen in most species .
Picinae has few shock-absorbing adaptations , and prefers to feed on the ground or to chip away at rotting wood and bark , habits observed in birds outside of the woodpecker family .
Used widely throughout the Indian subcontinent , Sitar became known in the western world through the work of Ravi Shankar beginning in the late 1950s and early 1960s after the Kinks ' top 10 single `` See My Friends '' featured a low tuned drone guitar which was widely mistaken to be Sitar .
Six or seven of these are played strings which run over curved , raised frets , and the remainder are sympathetic strings ( tarb , also known as taarif or tarafdaar ) which run underneath the frets and resonate in sympathy with the played strings .
The played strings run to tuning pegs on or near the head of Sitar , while the sympathetic strings , which are a variety of different lengths , pass through small holes in the fretboard to engage with the smaller tuning pegs that run down Sitar neck .
Most notable are older Rikhi Ram ( Delhi ) and older Hiren Roy ( Kolkata ) sitars depending upon which master built Sitar .
The tonic in the Indian solfège system is referred to as ṣaḍja , ṣaḍaj , or the shortened form sa , or khaṛaj , a dialectal variant of ṣaḍaj , not as vād , and the perfect fifth to which one or more of the drones strings are tuned is referred to as pañcam , not samvād .
Sitar is balanced between the player 's left foot and right knee .
Generally only the index and middle fingers are used for fingering although a few players occasionally use the third .
A specialized technique called `` meend '' involves pulling the main melody string down over the bottom portion of the sitar 's curved frets , with which Sitar can achieve a seven semitone range of microtonal notes ( it should be noted , however , that because of the sitar 's movable frets , sometimes a fret may be set to a microtone already , and no bending would be required ) .
Romanos III Argyros ( or Romanus III Argyrus ) ( , Rōmanos III Argyros ) ( 968 -- 11 April 1034 ) was Byzantine emperor from 15 November 1028 until Romanos III Argyros death .
Romanos Argyros was the son of an unnamed member of the Argyros family and a great-grandson of Romanos Romanos III Argyros Lekapenos .
Romanos III Argyros spent large sums upon new buildings and in endowing the monks , and in Romanos III Argyros endeavour to relieve the pressure of taxation disorganized the finances of the state .
It is listed on ISO-3166-2 as one of the four provinces of Ireland and `` IE-C '' is attributed to Connacht as Connacht country sub-division code .
The largest island in Connacht , and the island of Ireland , is Achill .
Sites such as the Céide Fields , Knocknarea , Listoghil , Carrowkeel Megalithic Cemetery and Rathcroghan , all demonstrate intensive occupation of Connacht far back into prehistory .
Connacht instead comprised dozens of major and minor túath ; rulers of larger túath ( Maigh Seóla , Uí Maine , Aidhne and Máenmaige ) were accorded high kingly status , while peoples such as the Gailenga , Corco Moga and Senchineoil were lesser peoples given the status of Déisi .
Older nations such as the Auteini and Nagnatae - recorded by Ptolemy ( c. AD 90 -- c. 168 ) in Geography - gave way to dynastic hereditary rule .
As evidenced by kings such as Mac Cairthinn mac Coelboth ( died 446 ) and Ailill Molt ( died c. 482 ) , even by the 5th century the gens was giving way to kinship all over Ireland , as both men were identified as of the Uí Enechglaiss and Uí Fiachrach dynasties , not of tribes .
Though the Ó Cellaigh 's were never elevated to the provincial kingship , Ui Maine existed as a semi-independent kingdom both before and after the demise of the Connacht kingship .
Tairrdelbach was highly innovative , building the first stone castles in Ireland , and more controversially , introducing the policy of primogeniture to a hostile Gaelic polity .
Castles were built in the 1120s at Galway ( where he based his fleet ) , Dunmore , Sligo and Ballinasloe , where he dug a new six-mile canal to divert the river Suck around the castle of Dun Ló .
Ruaidrí died at Cong in 1198 , noted as the annals as late `` King of Connacht and of All Ireland , both the Irish and the English '' .
Connacht merchant families , The Tribes of Galway , traded within Ireland , as well as Britain , France and Spain till it was reckoned one of Ireland 's most eminent towns .
They however remained devout Catholics , which displeased the Anglo-Irish administration , and later , the House of Stuart .
All of Connacht lordships remained in states of full or semi-independence from other Gaelic-Irish and Anglo-Irish rulers till the late 16th century , when the Tudor conquest of Ireland ( c. 1534 -- 1603 ) brought all under the direct rule of King James I of England .
Connacht was mainly at peace between 1691 and 1798 .
Historical references to Connacht are generally accepted from the early 6th century onwards , commencing with the battle of Claenloch between the Ui Fiachrach Aidhne and the Ui Maine .
Tor and Crioslach and Usban and Gotmann and Allgot settled in Connacht , according to Dubhaltach Mac Fhirbhisigh ( 768.4 , pp.44-45 , volume III , leabhar na nGenealach ) .
Romanos ( or Romanus ) IV Diogenes ( Greek : Ρωμανός Δ΄ Διογένης , Rōmanos IV Diogenēs ) was a member of the Byzantine military aristocracy who , after Romanos IV Diogenes marriage to the widowed empress Eudokia Makrembolitissa , was crowned Byzantine emperor and reigned from 1068 to 1071 .
The problem Romanus and Eudokia had in executing this plan was that Eudokia 's deceased husband , Constantine X , had made her swear an oath never to remarry .
Romanos IV Diogenes ordered a relief fleet to set sail , containing sufficient provisions and troops to enable them to hold out for much longer .
Romanos IV Diogenes preoccupation with the military had also made Romanos IV Diogenes unpopular with the provincial governors and the military hierarchy , as Romanos IV Diogenes was determined to ensure they could not abuse their positions , especially through corrupt practices .
Romanos , in return , offered to officially exchange Manzikert and Archesh for Hieropolis in Syria , which Romanos had taken three years previously .
Just three species are present in the New World : Wood Stork , Maguari Stork and Jabiru , which is the largest flying bird of the Americas .
Though both are similar in appearance and have similar ecological roles , the New World and Old World vultures evolved from different ancestors in different parts of the world and are not closely related .
It is listed on ISO-3166-2 as one of the four provinces of Ireland and `` IE-L '' is attributed to Leinster as Leinster country sub-division code .
Finn Mac Cool , or Fionn mac Cumhaill , was reputed to have built a stronghold at the Hill of Allen , on the edge of the Bog of Allen , in what was then Leinster .
The last major boundary changes occurred with the formation of County Wicklow ( 1603 -- 1606 ) , from lands in the north of Carlow ( which previously extended to the sea ) and most of southern Dublin .
Though the female and the male look alike , Locust can be distinguished by looking at the end of Locust abdomens .
In English the term `` locust '' is used for grasshopper species that change morphologically and behaviorally on crowding , forming swarms that develop from bands of immature stages called hoppers .
Locust also are referred to as statary and migratory morphs ( though strictly speaking their swarms are nomadic rather than migratory ) .
Plagues of Locust appear in both the Bible and the Quran , including one of the biblical Plagues of Egypt , where Locust ate all the crops of Egypt .
The word `` locust '' is derived from the Vulgar Latin locusta , which was originally used to refer to various types of crustaceans and insects ; English `` lobster '' is derived from Anglo-Saxon loppestre , which may come from Latin locusta .
Spanish has mostly preserved the original Latin usage , since the cognate term langosta can be used to refer both to a variety of lobster-like crustaceans and to the swarming grasshopper , while semantic confusion is avoided by employing qualifiers such as de la tierra ( of the land ) when referring to grasshoppers , Del mar and Del Rio ( of the sea/of the river ) when referring to lobsters and crayfish , respectively .
French presents an inverse case ; during the 16th century , the word sauterelle ( literally `` little hopper '' ) could mean either grasshopper or lobster ( sauterelle de mer ) .
In contemporary French usage , langouste is used almost exclusively to refer to the crustacean ( two insect exceptions being the langouste de désert and the langouste de Provence ) .
Often , the linguistic non-differentiation of animals not only regarded by science as different species , but that also often exist in radically different environments , is the result of culturally perceived similarities between organisms , as well as of abstract associations formed within a particular group 's mythology and folklore ( see Cicada mythology ) .
Even Islamic and Jewish dietary laws , which prohibit the consumption of other insects , allow Locust to be eaten , particularly as famine foods for the poor .
John was a pious and dedicated monarch who was determined to undo the damage John II Komnenos empire had suffered following the battle of Manzikert , half a century earlier .
In an effort to demonstrate the Byzantine ideal of the emperor 's role as the leader of the Christian world , John marched into Muslim Syria at the head of the combined forces of Byzantium and the Crusader states ; yet despite the great vigour with which John II Komnenos pressed the campaign , John 's hopes were disappointed by the treachery of John II Komnenos Crusader allies , who deliberately failed to fight against their common Muslim enemies at the crucial moment .
In particular little is known of the history of John 's domestic rule or policies .
This was a radical departure from the methods of John II Komnenos father , who had used the imperial family and its many connections to fill almost all senior administrative and military posts .
Emperor Alexios had thought John II Komnenos a good companion for John II Komnenos son , and so John II Komnenos had been brought up alongside the prince in the imperial household .
This was an unofficial position known at the time as the mesazon , and equivalent to a vizier or ` prime-minister ' .
Pope Innocent II , with the Church 's possessions in Italy under threat by Roger II , who supported Antipope Anacletus II , was also party to the alliance of Lothair and John II .
John II Komnenos organised a number of disputations between Greek and Latin theologians .
John , alongside John II Komnenos wife who shared in John II Komnenos religious and charitable works , is known to have undertaken church building on a considerable scale , including construction of the Monastery of Christ Pantokrator ( Zeyrek Mosque ) in Constantinople .
John II , and Axouch the Grand Domestic , recaptured Laodicea and Sozopolis , thus re-opening land communication with Antalya .
This route was especially important as it also led to Cilicia and the Crusader states of Syria Following the end of hostilities with Hungary John was able to concentrate on Asia Minor , which became the focus of John II Komnenos attention for most of John II Komnenos remaining years .
In order to restore the region to Byzantine control , John led a series of well planned and executed campaigns against the Turks , one of which resulted in the reconquest of the ancestral home of the Komnenoi at Kastamonu ( Kastra Komnenon ) , John II Komnenos then left a garrison of 2,000 men at Gangra .
This opened the route to the Principality of Antioch , where Raymond of Poitiers , Prince of Antioch , and Joscelin II , Count of Edessa , recognized themselves John II Komnenos vassals in 1137 .
King Fulk of Jerusalem , fearing that the emperor 's presence with overwhelming military force would constrain John II Komnenos to make an act of homage and formally recognise Byzantine suzerainty over John II Komnenos kingdom , begged the emperor to bring only a modest escort .
John is recorded as citing two main reasons for choosing Manuel over John II Komnenos older brother Isaac : these were Isaac 's irascibility , and the courage that Manuel had shown on campaign at Neocaesareia .
States and territories with borders on the sea ( clockwise from north ) include : the People 's Republic of China ( including Macau and Hong Kong ) , the Republic of China ( Taiwan ) , the Philippines , Malaysia , Brunei , Indonesia , Singapore , Thailand , Cambodia , and Vietnam .
The relative shear between Indochina and China caused South China Sea to open .
Since opening the South China Sea has been the repository of large sediment volumes delivered by the Mekong River , Red River and Pearl River .
Both People 's Republic of China ( PRC ) and the Republic of China ( ROC ) claim almost the entire body as their own , demarcating their claims within what is known as the nine-dotted line , which claims overlap with virtually every other country in the region .
ASEAN in general , and Malaysia in particular , has been keen to ensure that the territorial disputes within South China Sea do not escalate into armed conflict .
On July 22 , 2011 , one of India 's amphibious assault vessels , the INS Airavat which was on a friendly visit to Vietnam , was reportedly contacted at a distance of 45 nautical miles from the Vietnamese coast in the disputed South China Sea on an open radio channel by a vessel identifying itself as the Chinese Navy and stating that the ship was entering Chinese waters .
India supports freedom of navigation in international waters , including in South China Sea , and the right of passage in accordance with accepted principles of international law .
Theophilos (emperor) was the second emperor of the Phrygian dynasty and the last emperor to support iconoclasm .
In 836 , after the expiration of the 20-year peace treaty between the Empire and Bulgaria , Theophilos (emperor) ravaged the Bulgarian frontier .
Vlastimir of Serbia united several tribes , and Theophilos (emperor) granted the Serbs independence ; Vlastimir acknowledged nominal overlordship of the Emperor .
Theophilos (emperor) character has been the subject of considerable discussion , some regarding Theophilos (emperor) as one of the best Byzantine Emperors , others as an ordinary and not a particularly significant ruler .
There is no doubt that Theophilos (emperor) did Theophilos (emperor) best to check corruption and oppression on the part of Theophilos (emperor) officials , and that Theophilos (emperor) administered justice with strict impartiality .
Despite the drain of the war in Asia and the large sums spent by Theophilos (emperor) on building , commerce , and industry , the finances of the Empire flourished , largely due to highly efficient administration .
Theophilos (emperor) is the second emperor of the Phrygian dynasty and the last emperor to support iconoclasm .
Theophilos (emperor) is the son of the Byzantine Emperor Michael II and his wife Thekla , and the godson of Emperor Leo V the Armenian .
The Volkswagen Kübelwagen ( literally translated as `` tub truck '' , for Volkswagen Kübelwagen resemblance to a metal bathtub on wheels ) was a light military vehicle designed by Ferdinand Porsche and built by Volkswagen during World War II for use by the German military ( both Wehrmacht and Waffen-SS ) .
Although Adolf Hitler discussed with Ferdinand Porsche the possibility of military application of the Volkswagen as early as April 1934 , it was not until January 1938 , that high-ranking Third Reich army officials formally approached Porsche about designing an inexpensive , light-weight military transport vehicle that could be operated reliably both on - and off-road in even the most extreme conditions , suggesting that the Beetle could provide the basis for such a vehicle .
Volkswagen Kübelwagen light weight and ZF self-locking differential compensated for the lack of 4 × 4 capabilities .
Further development of the Type 62 took place during 1939 , including a more angular body design ; and pre-production models were field-tested in the invasion of Poland that started in September that year .
Revised dampers , 41 cm wheels and a limited slip differential , as well as countless small modifications completed the specification .
Most notably -- thanks to Volkswagen Kübelwagen smooth , flat underbody -- the Kübel would propel Volkswagen Kübelwagen much like a motorised sled when Volkswagen Kübelwagen wheels were sinking into sand , snow or mud , allowing Volkswagen Kübelwagen to follow tracked vehicles with remarkable tenacity .
Although Irene of Athens was an orphan , Irene of Athens uncle , Constantine Sarantapechos , was a patrician and possibly strategos of the theme of Hellas .
Irene of Athens negotiated a marriage between Irene of Athens son and Rotrude , a daughter of Charlemagne by his third wife Hildegard .
Irene next had to subdue a rebellion led by Elpidius , the strategos of Sicily , whose family was tortured and imprisoned when a fleet was sent , which succeeded in defeating the Sicilians .
Natural History (Pliny) is the only work by Pliny to have survived and the last that he published , lacking a final revision at the time of his death during the AD 79 eruption of Vesuvius .
After an initial survey of cosmology and geography , Pliny starts his treatment of animals with the human race , `` for whose sake great nature appears to have created all other things '' .
These monstrous races -- the Cynocephali or Dog-Heads , the Sciapodae , whose single foot could act as a sunshade , the mouthless Astomi , who lived on scents -- were not strictly new .
Natural History (Pliny) was one of the first ancient texts to be printed , in 1469 , and over two hundred editions had been produced by the end of the nineteenth century .
The work was probably published with little revision by the author 's nephew Pliny the Younger , who , when telling the story of a tame dolphin and describing the floating islands of the Vadimonian Lake thirty years later , has apparently forgotten that both are to be found in his uncle 's work .
Among the later manuscripts , the codex Vesontinus , formerly at Besançon ( 11th century ) , has been divided into three portions , now in Rome , Paris , and Leiden respectively , while there is also a transcript of the whole of this manuscript at Leiden .
Despite , or perhaps because of , the multiplicity of texts in circulation , many were in a poor state.What would Cicero , or Livy , or the other great men of the past , Natural History (Pliny) above all , think if they could return to life and read their own works ?
Philemon Holland 's much improved translation of 1601 and further versions multiplied as Pliny 's reputation grew during the Renaissance .
He critically notes the following of perfumes : `` Perfumes are the most pointless of luxuries , for pearls and jewels are at least passed on the one 's heirs , and clothes last for a time , but perfumes lose their fragrance and perish as soon as Natural History (Pliny) are used '' .
Other substances added include myrrh , cinnamon , and balsam gum .
The keeping of aquaria was a popular pastime of the rich , and Natural History (Pliny) provides several amusing anecdotes of the problems of owners becoming too closely attached to their fishes .
Natural History (Pliny) has an extensive discussion of metals including gold , silver , copper , mercury , lead , tin and iron , as well as their many alloys such as electrum , bronze , pewter , and steel .
Natural History (Pliny) is probably referring to the reverse overshot water-wheels operated by treadmill and found in Roman mines in the 1920s as discussed below .
Britain , he says , is very rich in lead , which is found on the surface at many places , and thus very easy to extract ; production was so high that a law was passed attempting to restrict mining .
The topic concentrates on the most valuable gemstones , because Natural History (Pliny) gives him yet another opportunity to criticize the obsession with luxury products such as engraved gems and hardstone carvings .
Natural History (Pliny) returns to the problem of fraud and the detection of false gems using several tests , including the scratch test , where counterfeit gems can be marked by a steel file , and genuine ones not .
Natural History (Pliny) is also a source for some interesting devices and machines used in cultivation and processing the crops .
For a number of items relating to works of art near the coast of Asia Minor and in the adjacent islands , Natural History (Pliny) was indebted to the general , statesman , orator and historian Gaius Licinius Mucianus , who died before 77 .
Natural History (Pliny) mentions the works of art collected by Vespasian in the Temple of Peace and in his other galleries ( xxxiv .
Natural History (Pliny) shows the Trojan priest Laocoön and his sons Antiphantes and Thymbraeus being strangled by sea serpents .
Field work has also established the extensive use of hydraulic mining to prospect for gold by construction of several aqueducts and many water reservoirs and tanks at the minehead , just as Natural History (Pliny) describes .
Natural History (Pliny) describes methods of underground mining , including the use of fire-setting to attack the gold-bearing rock and so extract the ore .
Natural History (Pliny) involved creating a fire against a hard rock working to weaken Natural History (Pliny) sufficiently to be able to remove Natural History (Pliny) effectively , followed by quenching with water or vinegar .
His description of construction of the aqueducts needed to prospect for gold-bearing ore by removing overburden and work the alluvial deposits bears the hallmarks of the eyewitness , and he served as Procurator in northern Hispania when the region , in 73 AD , was experiencing a gold rush .
Because of a curious disease of the human mind , Natural History (Pliny) pleases us to enshrine in history records of bloodshed and slaughter , so that those ignorant of the facts of the world may become acquainted with the crimes of mankind .
Natural History (Pliny) is a source for some interesting devices and machines used in cultivation and processing the crops .
Natural History (Pliny) is a compilation ultimately founded on the lost textbooks of Xenocrates and on the biographies of Duris and Antigonus .
Born into the Macedonian dynasty that had ruled the Byzantine Empire for almost two hundred years , Theodora (11th century) was co-empress with Theodora (11th century) sister Zoe for two months in 1042 and sole empress from 11 January 1055 to 31 August 1056 .
Theodora (11th century) was the youngest daughter of the Byzantine Emperor Constantine VIII and Helena , daughter of Alypius .
Secondly , Theodora (11th century) claimed that since Romanos and Theodora (11th century) were third cousins , it was too close a blood relationship for marriage to occur .
At an assembly at Hagia Sophia , the people escorted a furious Theodora from Petrion , and proclaimed Theodora (11th century) empress along with Zoe .
Although Theodora (11th century) Theodora (11th century) appeared together at meetings of the Senate , or when they gave public audiences , it was soon apparent that their joint reign was under considerable strain .
Although officially Theodora and Zoe continued to be recognised as empresses and Theodora continued to appear at all official functions , all power devolved onto Theodora (11th century) brother-in-law .
This led to a popular uprising by the citizens of Constantinople in 1044 , which was only quietened by the appearance of Zoe and Theodora (11th century) at a balcony , who reassured the mob that they were not in any danger of assassination .
Having no children and being the last member of Theodora (11th century) dynasty , Theodora (11th century) had chosen one of Theodora (11th century) favorites , the former military finance minister , Michael VI Bringas , as Theodora (11th century) successor on the recommendation of Theodora (11th century) chief minister , Leo Paraspondylos .
Theodora (11th century) is the youngest daughter of the Byzantine Emperor Constantine VIII and Helena , daughter of Alypius .
In Vancouver 2010 , four athletes -- Catriona LeMay Doan , Wayne Gretzky , Steve Nash and Nancy Greene -- were given the honor of lighting Olympic Flame simultaneously ( indoor ) before Wayne Gretzky transferred Olympic Flame to an outdoor cauldron at Vancouver 's waterfront .
Two years later , at the 2012 Summer Olympics in London , seven young athletes-Callum Airlie , Jordan Duckitt , Desiree Henry , Katie Kirk , Cameron MacRitchie , Aidan Reynolds and Adelle Tracey-were given the honor to light the flame on one of 204 copper petals before converging to form the cauldron for the Games .
Olympic Flame , but not the flame , was taken into space by astronauts in 1996 and 2000 .
The torch used for the final entry to the stadium and the lighting of the cauldron was of a different design , also a feature that would re-appear in later years .
The number of torches made has varied from , for example , 22 for Helsinki in 1952 , 6,200 for the 1980 Moscow Games and 8,000 for the London 2012 Games .
Thus , the fires contained in the torches and Olympic cauldrons all trace a common lineage back to the same Olympia lighting ceremony .
Theodoros I Komnenos Laskaris ( , Theodōros I Laskaris ) ( c. 1174/1175 -- 1221/August , 1222 ) was Emperor of Nicaea ( 1204 -- 1221 or 1205 -- 1222 ) .
Miller identified said sister with the wife of Marco I Sanudo and mother of Angelo Sanudo .
In 1198/9 , Theodore married Anna Angelina , daughter of the Byzantine Emperor Alexios III Angelos and Euphrosyne Doukaina Kamatera .
At first Theodore did not claim the imperial title , perhaps because Theodore I Laskaris father-in-law and Theodore I Laskaris brother were both still living , perhaps because of the imminent Latin invasion , or perhaps because there was no Patriarch of Constantinople to crown him Emperor .
The eldest was Isaakios Doukas Vatatzes ( died 1261 ) , who married and had two children : Ioannes Vatatzes ( born 1215 ) , who married to Eudokia Angelina and had two daughters Theodora Doukaina Vatatzaina , wife of Michael VIII Palaiologos , and Maria Vatatzaina , married to Michael Doukas Glabas Tarchaneiotes , Military Goveror of Thrace ; and a daughter , married to Konstantinos Strategopoulos .
In spite of some reverses against the Latin Empire in 1240 , John III was able to take advantage of Ivan Asen II 's death in 1241 to impose John III Doukas Vatatzes own suzerainty over Thessalonica ( in 1242 ) , and later to annex this city , as well as much of Bulgarian Thrace in 1246 .
Presbyter ( Greek πρεσβύτερος , presbuteros : `` elder '' , or `` priest '' in Christian usage ) in the New Testament refers to a leader in local Christian congregations , then often not clearly distinguished from episkopos , presbyter referring to ordinary priests or elders and episkopos referring exclusively to the full order or office of bishop .
The Roman Catholic Church , the Orthodox Church , the non-Chalcedonian churches and similar groups typically refer to presbyters in English as priests ( priest is etymologically derived from the Greek presbyteros via the Latin presbyter ) .
The flowers are small , purple-brown , and , being wind-pollinated , are apetalous ; Ulmus americana emerge in early spring before the leaves .
For example , in Central Park and Tompkins Square Park in New York City , stands of several large elms originally planted by Frederick Law Olmsted survive because of their isolation from neighboring areas in New York where there had been heavy mortality .
Elms have been able to survive and to reproduce in areas where the disease had eliminated old trees , although most of these young elms eventually succumb to the disease at a relatively young age .
Although the European elm bark beetle is known to have occurred across southern and central Alberta , Ulmus americana does not appear to be carrying the disease in these areas .
Some cities such as Kansas City , Missouri , had used mostly American elms in planting Ulmus americana city streets and had had some of the finest shaded residential streets in the nation , until the disease almost obliterated these plantings in the late 1960s and early 1970s .
Ohio botanist William B. Werthner , discussing the contrast between open-grown and forest-grown American elms , noted that : In the open , with an abundance of air and light , the main trunk divides into several leading branches which leave the trunk at a sharp angle and continue to grow upward , gradually diverging , dividing and subdividing into long , flexible branchlets whose ends , at last , float lightly in the air , giving the tree a round , somewhat flattened top of beautifully regular proportions and characteristically fine twiggery .
American elms have been planted in North America beyond Ulmus americana natural range as far north as central Alberta , and south to Lake Worth , Florida .
Wood from the tree was made into furniture , canes , walking sticks and various trinkets that Philadelphians kept as relics .
The tree , an American white elm , became a celebrated attraction , with Ulmus americana own plaque , a fence constructed around Ulmus americana and a road moved in order to help preserve Ulmus americana .
A Harvard `` professor of plant anatomy '' examined the tree rings days after the tree was felled and pronounced Ulmus americana between 204 and 210 years old , making Ulmus americana at most 62 years old when Washington took command of the troops at Cambridge .
Ulmus americana , located in a parking lot directly across the street from the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building in Oklahoma City , OK , survived a terrorist bombing on April 19 , 1995 that killed 168 people and destroyed the building .
The nobility and arching grace of the American elm in Ulmus americana heyday , on farms , in villages , in towns and on campuses , were celebrated in the books of photographs of Wallace Nutting ( Massachusetts Beautiful , N.Y.
John V Palaiologos ( or Palaeologus ) ( , Iōannēs V Palaiologos ) ( 18 June 1332 -- 16 February 1391 ) was a Byzantine emperor , who succeeded John V Palaiologos father in 1341 , at age nine .
John V appealed to the West for help , proposing to end the schism between the Byzantine and Latin churches by submitting the patriarchate to the supremacy of Rome .
Christopher Columbus was one of the first Europeans to encounter them ( in the Caribbean ) , and called them `` peppers '' because they , like black and white pepper of the Piper genus known in Europe , have a spicy hot taste unlike other foodstuffs .
Diego Álvarez Chanca , a physician on Columbus ' second voyage to the West Indies in 1493 , brought the first chili peppers to Spain and first wrote about their medicinal effects in 1494 .
Chili pepper journeyed from India , through Central Asia and Turkey , to Hungary , where it became the national spice in the form of paprika .
Green and red bell peppers , for example , are the same cultivar of C. annuum , immature peppers being green .
When consumed , capsaicinoids bind with pain receptors in the mouth and throat that are responsible for sensing heat .
Chili pepper pods , which are berries , are used fresh or dried .
Some states in India , such as Rajasthan , make entire dishes only by using spices and Chili pepper .
Fresh or dried Chili pepper are often used to make hot sauce , a bottled condiment to add spice to other dishes .
Yellow and especially green chilies ( which are essentially unripe fruit ) contain a considerably lower amount of both substances .
The name of the plant bears no relation to Chile , the country , which is named after the Quechua chin ( `` cold '' ) , tchili ( `` snow '' ) , or chilli ( `` where the land ends '' ) .

Kantakouzenos was far too ready to invoke the aid of foreigners in John VI Kantakouzenos European quarrels ; and as John VI Kantakouzenos had no money to pay them , this gave them a ready pretext for seizing upon a European town .
It possesses the merit of being well arranged and homogenous , the incidents being grouped round the chief actor in the person of the author , but the information is defective on matters with which John VI Kantakouzenos is not directly concerned .
At the time of these events this also was a private company dealing in national debt , and the crash of South Sea Company rival consolidated South Sea Company position as banker to the British government .
Edward Harley and John Blunt together had devised a scheme to consolidate this debt in a similar manner to that previously performed by the Bank of England , although the Bank still held the monopoly on operating as a bank .
This allowed anyone with advance knowledge to buy debt cheap and sell at an immediate profit , and made South Sea Company possible for Harley to bring further financial supporters into the scheme , such as James Bateman and Theodore Janssen .
Two thirds were to be male , and 90 % adult .
South Sea Company was heavily dependent on the goodwill of government and so , when government changed , so too did the company board .
Queen Anne died 1 August 1714 and at the election of directors in 1715 the Prince of Wales ( future King George II ) was elected as Governor of South Sea Company .
The new King , George I and the Prince of Wales both had significant holdings in South Sea Company .
James Cragg , as Postmaster General , was responsible for intercepting mail on behalf of the government to obtain political and financial information .
Whigs , Horatio Townshend , brother in law of Robert Walpole and the Duke of Argyll were elected directors .
By the time of the next director 's elections in 1718 politics had changed again , with a schism within the Whigs between Walpole 's faction supporting the Prince of Wales and James Stanhope 's supporting the King .
In November 1718 Sub-Governor Bateman and Deputy Governor Shepheard both died .
Any prospect of profit from trade , for which the company had purchased ships and had been planning South Sea Company next ventures , disappeared .
A Scottish economist and financier , John Law , exiled after killing a man in a duel , had travelled around Europe before settling in France .
The 1719 scheme was a distinct success from the government 's perspective and South Sea Company sought to repeat South Sea Company .
Money was moving around Europe , and other flotations threatened to soak up available capital ( two insurance schemes in December 1719 each sought to raise # 3 million ) .
The share price had risen from the time the scheme was proposed : from # 128 in January 1720 , to # 175 in February , # 330 in March and , following the scheme 's acceptance , to # 550 at the end of May .
Amongst the bubble companies investigated were two supported by Lords Onslow and Chetwynd respectively , for insuring shipping .
However , the schemes had the support of Walpole and Craggs , so that the larger part of the Bubble act ( which finally resulted in June 1720 from the committee 's investigations ) was devoted to creating charters for the Royal Exchange Assurance Corporation and the London Assurance Corporation .
Furthermore , the scramble for liquidity appeared internationally as `` bubbles '' were also ending in Amsterdam and Paris .
The South Seas Company 's charter ( of 1711 ) provided it with exclusive access to all of Middle and South America .
Furthermore , when ties between Spain and Britain deteriorated in 1718 the short-term prospects of South Sea Company were very poor .
Despite problems with speculation , the South Sea Company was relatively successful at slave trading and meeting South Sea Company quota ( it was unusual for other , similarly chartered companies to fulfill South Sea Company quotas ) .
According to records compiled by David Eltis and others , during the course of 96 voyages in twenty-five years , South Sea Company purchased 34,000 slaves of whom 30,000 survived the voyages across the Atlantic .
The British Parliament confirmed that a British Arctic `` whale-fishery '' would continue to benefit by freedom from Customs duties and in 1724 South Sea Company decided to commence whaling .
They had 12 whale-ships built on the River Thames and these went to the Greenland seas in 1725 .
At this time there were hardly any experienced whalemen remaining in Britain and the Company had to engage Dutch and Danish whalemen for the key posts aboard their ships , e.g.
This , and the subsequent Acts , required the whalers to meet conditions regarding the crewing and equipping of the whale-ships that closely resembled the conditions suggested by Elking in 1722 .
In spite of the extended duty-free concessions , and the prospect of real subsidies as well , the Court and Directors of the South Sea Company decided that South Sea Company could not expect to make profits from Arctic whaling .
A tailplane , also known as horizontal stabilizer ( or horizontal stabiliser ) , is a small lifting surface located on the tail ( empennage ) behind the main lifting surfaces of a fixed-wing aircraft as well as other non-fixed-wing aircraft such as helicopters and gyroplanes .
On many flying wings such as the Fauvel AV .36 and tailless deltas such as the Dassault Mirage III , the downward force is instead provided by the trailing edge of the wing .
On some airplanes built before World War I , such as the Bleriot XI , the center of gravity is between the center of lift from the wings and the tailplane , which instead of providing a downward force , provided an upward one .
The advantage to this is a significant reduction in induced drag caused by Tailplane , and in the case of the F-16 , improved maneuverability .
( See main article , Stabilizer ( aircraft ) , for references ) An aeroplane with a conventional wing and no tailplane is normally unstable in pitch ( longitudinal instability ) .
Elevator In addition Tailplane helps adjust for changes in the center of lift , and center of gravity caused by changes in speed and attitude , or when fuel is burned off , or when cargo or payload is dropped from the aircraft .
Stabilators or all-moving tails In transonic flight shock waves generated by Tailplane render Tailplane unusable .
However , Mrs. Gaugain , in her 1840 The Lady 's Assistant for Executing Useful and Fancy Designs in Knitting , Netting , and Crotchet Work , refers to `` Tambour , or Crotchet , '' then proceeds to call Crochet `` tambour '' in all the instructions , indicating a strong connection believed in at the time of crochet 's beginning , and that Crochet was , perhaps , the older name .
Early crochet hooks ranged from primitive bent needles in a cork handle , used by poor Irish lace workers , to expensively crafted silver , brass , steel , ivory and bone hooks set into a variety of handles , some of which were better designed to show off a lady 's hands than Crochet were to work with thread .
Crochet laces in the new Edwardian era , peaking between 1910 and 1920 , became even more elaborate in texture and complicated stitching .
Filet crochet , Tunisian crochet , tapestry crochet , broomstick lace , hairpin lace , cro-hooking , and Irish crochet are all variants of the basic crochet method .
Crochet hooks used for Tunisian crochet are elongated and have a stopper at the end of the handle , while double-ended crochet hooks have a hook on both ends of the handle .
Skeins and balls are generally sold with a yarn band , a label that describes Crochet weight , length , dye lot , fiber content , washing instructions , suggested needle size , likely gauge , etc.
The thickness or weight of Crochet is a significant factor in determining the gauge , i.e. , how many stitches and rows are required to cover a given area for a given stitch pattern .
In general , yarns become stronger with more twist ( also called worst ) , longer fibers and thicker yarns ( more fibers ) ; for example , thinner yarns require more twist than do thicker yarns to resist breaking under tension .
In plying , two or more yarns are spun together , almost always in the opposite sense from which Crochet were spun individually ; for example , two Z-twist yarns are usually plied with an S-twist .
The single yarns may be dyed separately before plying , or afterwords to give Crochet a uniform look .
Many Crochet items are composed of individual motifs which are then joined together , are by sewing or crocheting , whereas knitting is usually composed of one fabric , such as entrelac .
The similarities to Base2 math , with Crochet series of 0s and 1s , are obvious .
Worldwide 0.05 -- 2 % of people are estimated to have anaphylaxis at some point in their life and rates appear to be increasing .
Anaphylaxis typically presents with many different symptoms over minutes or hours with an average onset of 5 to 30 minutes if exposure is intravenous and 2 hours for foods .
The most common areas affected include : skin ( 80 -- 90 % ) , respiratory ( 70 % ) , gastrointestinal ( 30 -- 45 % ) , heart and vasculature ( 10 -- 45 % ) , and central nervous system ( 10 -- 15 % ) with usually two or more being involved .
In Western cultures , ingestion of or exposure to peanuts , wheat , tree nuts , shellfish , fish , milk , and eggs are the most prevalent causes .
The frequency of a reaction to an agent partly depends on the frequency of Anaphylaxis use and partly on Anaphylaxis intrinsic properties .
Anaphylaxis to aspirin and NSAIDs occurs in about one in every 50,000 persons .
Skin allergy testing ( such as patch testing ) is available for certain foods and venoms .
Oral immunotherapy may be effective at desensitizing some people to certain food including milk , eggs , nuts and peanuts ; however adverse effects are common .
A period of in hospital observation for between 2 and 24 hours is recommended for people once Anaphylaxis have returned to normal due to concerns of biphasic anaphylaxis .
Antihistamines ( both H1 and H2 ) , while commonly used and assumed effective based on theoretical reasoning , are poorly supported by evidence .
Outcomes in those with exercise-induced anaphylaxis are typically good , with fewer and less severe episodes as people get older .
Enrico Mattei , who became a powerful figure in Italy , was a Christian Democrat , and a member of parliament from 1948 to 1953 .
Agip 's financial value immediately grew in the Stock Exchange markets , and the company ( owned by the State , but operating as a private company ) became at once solid and important .
The gas was not a mere substitute for imported oil , but a cheaper and more functional substitute for imported coal for the growing industrial activities of .
To opponents who charged that Enrico Mattei was helping Communists and making Italy dependent on a capricious flow from the Soviet Union , Mattei answered that Enrico Mattei bought from the cheapest sources .
In 1960 , after concluding the agreement with the Soviet Union and while negotiating with China , Enrico Mattei publicly declared that the American monopoly was over .
The reaction was initially mild , and Enrico Mattei ( ENI ) was invited to take part in the partition of the prospecting map in the Sahara .
Joan of Navarre, Queen of England ( c. 1370 -- 10 June 1437 ) was a Duchess consort of Brittany and a Queen consort of England .
According to the Encyclopædia Britannica , affection developed between Joanna and Henry Bolingbroke ( the future King Henry IV ) while he resided at the Breton court during his banishment from England .
Alfonso III ( c. 848 -- December 910 ) , called the Great , was the king of León , Galicia and Asturias from 866 until Alfonso III of León death .
Little is known about Alfonso except the bare facts of Alfonso III of León reign and of Alfonso III of León comparative success in consolidating the kingdom during the weakness of the Umayyad princes of Córdoba .
An electromagnetic coil ( or simply a `` coil '' ) is formed when a conductor ( usually an insulated solid copper wire ) is wound around a core or form to create an inductor or electromagnet .
For small power and signal applications , in which currents are low and the potential difference between adjacent turns is small , Coil are often wound from enamelled magnet wire , such as Formvar wire .
Each strand is individually insulated , and the strands are arranged so that at certain points in Coil , or throughout the whole winding , each portion occupies different relative positions in the complete conductor .
When this capacitance is problematic multiple layers are often replaced with a single layer , as in a pancake coil , or a solenoid with a single layer is used .
A coil tap is a wiring feature found on some electrical transformers , inductors and coil pickups , all of which are sets of wire coils .
Alfonso IV ( c. 890s -- 933 ) , called the Monk , was King of León from 925 ( or 926 ) and King of Galicia from 929 , until Alfonso IV of León abdicated in 931 .

This corrupts the bottom of the screen and the entire right half of the maze with seemingly random symbols , making Pac-Man impossible to eat enough dots to beat the level .
Pac-Man was based on the concept of eating , and the original Japanese title was , inspired by the Japanese onomatopoeic slang phrase , where paku-paku describes ( the sound of ) the mouth movement when widely opened and then closed in succession .
Set in 1993 London , About a Boy (novel) features two main protagonists : Will Freeman , a 36-year-old bachelor , and Marcus Brewer , an incongruous schoolboy described as ` introverted ' by his suicidal mother , Fiona , despite his tendencies to bond and interact with people .
Will , a socially aware and `` trendy '' person , aids Marcus to fit into 1990s youth culture by encouraging him not to get his hair cut by his mother , buying him Adidas trainers , and introducing him to contemporary music such as Nirvana .
The novel ends during a three-way dialogue between Marcus , Will and Fiona where Will , to see if Marcus has truly changed , proposes the idea that he play a Joni Mitchell song on Fiona 's piano , which she immediately becomes enthusiastic of .
About a Boy (novel) removes any reference to the band Nirvana and Kurt Cobain .
The soundtrack to the film , including several full songs and numerous incidental pieces , was composed entirely by British singer-songwriter Badly Drawn Boy .
Ludmilla Tourischeva ( Russian : Людми́ла Ива́новна Тури́щева alternate spellings : Ludmilla Turischeva ; Ludmilla Tourischcheva ; Ljudmila Ivanovna Turichtchieva ; , born October 7 , 1952 in Grozny ) is a former Russian gymnast and a nine-time Olympic medalist for the Soviet Union .
This provoked the Second Civil War ( 1648 -- 49 ) and a second defeat for Charles I of England , who was subsequently captured , tried , convicted , and executed for high treason .
The monarchy was abolished and a republic called the Commonwealth of England , also referred to as the Cromwellian Interregnum , was declared .
The second son of King James VI of Scotland and Anne of Denmark , Charles I of England was born in Dunfermline Palace , Fife , on 19 November 1600 .
Eventually , Charles apparently conquered Charles I of England physical infirmity , which might have been caused by rickets , and grew to a peak height of 5 ft 4 .
Frederick 's acceptance of the crown in September 1619 marked the beginning of the turmoil that would develop into the Thirty Years ' War , which the English Parliament and public quickly grew to see as a polarised continental struggle between Catholics and Protestants .
James , who had been seeking marriage between the new Prince of Wales and the Spanish Habsburg Infanta , Maria Anna of Spain , began to see the Spanish Match as a possible diplomatic means of achieving peace in Europe .
Charles , like Charles I of England father , considered the discussion of Charles I of England marriage in the Commons impertinent and an infringement of Charles I of England father 's royal prerogative .
When Charles returned to London in October , without a bride and to a rapturous and relieved public welcome , Charles I of England and Buckingham pushed a reluctant King James to declare war on Spain .
James also requested that Parliament sanction the marriage between the Prince of Wales and a sister of Louis XIII of France , Henrietta Maria , whom Charles I of England had seen in Paris while en route to Spain .
In the Treaty of Berwick , Charles regained custody of Charles I of England Scottish fortresses and secured the dissolution of the Covenanters ' interim government , albeit at the decisive concession that both the Scottish Parliament and General Assembly of the Scottish Church were called .
By this stage Strafford , Lord Deputy of Ireland since 1632 , had emerged as Charles I of England right hand man and together with Laud , pursued a policy of `` Thorough '' that aimed to make central royal authority more efficient and effective at the expense of local or anti-government interests .
Various disputes between native and coloniser concerning a transference of land ownership from Catholic to Protestant , particularly in relation to the plantation of Ulster , coupled with the gradual overshadowing of the Irish Parliament by the English Parliament would sow the seeds of conflagration in Ireland that , despite its initial chaos , provide the catalyst for direct armed combat within England between royalists and parliamentarians .
The success of the trial against Strafford weakened Charles I of England influence in Ireland , whilst also providing a natural conduit for cooperation between the Gaelic Irish and Old English , who had hitherto been antagonistic towards one another .
Thus , in the conflict between the Gaelic Irish and New English settlers , in the Irish Rebellion of 1641 , the Old English sided with the Gaelic Irish whilst simultaneously professing their loyalty to Charles I of England .
However , news of the warrant reached Parliament ahead of Charles I of England , and the wanted men -- Pym , John Hampden , Denzil Holles , William Strode and Sir Arthur Haselrig -- slipped away by boat shortly before Charles entered the House of Commons with an armed guard on 4 January 1642 .
No English sovereign ever had ( or has since ) entered the House of Commons by force .
Hammond , however , confined Charles I of England in Carisbrooke Castle and informed Parliament that Charles I of England was in his custody .
Under the agreement , called the `` Engagement '' , the Scots undertook to invade England on Charles 's behalf and restore Charles I of England to the throne on condition of the establishment of Presbyterianism in England for three years .
The Rump Commons declared itself capable of legislating alone , abolished the upper house , passed a bill creating a court for Charles I of England trial , and declared the bill an act without the need for royal assent .
An estimated 300,000 people , or 6 % of the population , died during the war .
Only 68 ( all firm Parliamentarians ) attended Charles I of England trial on charges of high treason and `` other high crimes '' that began on 20 January 1649 in Westminster Hall .
The court , by contrast , proposed an interpretation of the law that legitimised the trial , which was founded on '' ... the fundamental proposition that the King of England was not a person , but an office whose every occupant was entrusted with a limited power to govern ` by and according to the laws of the land and not otherwise ' '' .

An Irishman named Gunning is widely believed to have beheaded Charles , and a plaque naming Charles I of England as the executioner is on show in the King 's Head pub in Galway , Ireland .
The Colony of Carolina in North America -- which later separated into North Carolina and South Carolina -- was named after Charles I of England , as was its major city of Charleston .
To the north in the Virginia Colony , Cape Charles , Charles River Shire and the Charles City Shire were all likewise named after Charles I of England , although the king personally named the Charles River .

In physics , a frame of reference ( or reference frame ) may refer to a coordinate system used to represent and measure properties of objects such as Frame of reference position and orientation .
Alternatively , in relativity , the phrase can be used to refer to the relationship between a moving observer and the phenomenon or phenomena under observation .
An observational frame of reference , often referred to as a physical frame of reference , a frame of reference , or simply a frame , is a physical concept related to an observer and the observer 's state of motion .
Here we adopt the view expressed by Kumar and Barve : an observational frame of reference is characterized only by Frame of reference state of motion .
In special relativity , the distinction is sometimes made between an observer and Frame of reference .
In Newtonian mechanics , a more restricted definition requires only that Newton 's first law holds true ; that is , a Newtonian inertial frame is one in which a free particle travels in a straight line at constant speed , or is at rest .
In particle physics experiments , it is often useful to transform energies and momenta of particles from the lab frame where Frame of reference are measured , to the center of momentum frame `` COM frame '' in which calculations are sometimes simplified , since potentially all kinetic energy still present in the COM frame may be used for making new particles .
In this connection it may be noted that the clocks and rods often used to describe observers ' measurement equipment in thought , in practice are replaced by a much more complicated and indirect metrology that is connected to the nature of the vacuum , and uses atomic clocks that operate according to the standard model and that must be corrected for gravitational time dilation .
Modern historians suspect this maternal connection to be a genealogical fabrication created by Constantius Chlorus son Constantine Constantius Chlorus , and that Constantius Chlorus family were of humble origins .
Throughout 287 and into 288 , Constantius , under the command of Maximian , was involved in a war against the Alamanni , carrying out attacks on the territory of the barbarian tribes across the Rhine and Danube rivers .
Only when Constantius Chlorus felt ready ( and only when Maximian finally came to relieve Constantius Chlorus at the Rhine frontier ) did Constantius Chlorus assemble two invasion fleets with the intent of crossing the English Channel .
The campaign was avidly pursued by Galerius , who noticed that Constantius was well-disposed towards the Christians , and who saw it as a method of advancing Constantius Chlorus career prospects with the aging Diocletian .
Between 303 and 305 , Galerius began maneuvering to ensure that Constantius Chlorus would be in a position to take power from Constantius after the passing of Diocletian .
Eusebius 's Life of Constantine claims that Constantius was Constantius Chlorus a Christian , although Constantius Chlorus pretended to be a pagan , and while Caesar under Diocletian , took no part in the Emperor 's persecutions .

Before the Grand Canal was rebuilt , grain was transferred to Beijing in two ways ; one route was simply via the East China Sea , from the port of Liujiagang ( near Suzhou ) ; the other was a far more laborious process of transferring the grain from large to small shallow barges ( after passing the Huai River and having to cross southwestern Shandong ) , then transferred back to large river barges on the Yellow River before finally reaching Beijing .

After National Holiday (Quebec) became a statutory holiday , June 24 was officially a holiday for all Quebecers rather than only those of French-Canadian or Catholic origins .
During and immediately after the Quiet Revolution , National Holiday (Quebec) became highly politicized .
Governor General Georges Vanier , who , as viceroy , had always fostered unity and biculturalism , found himself the target of Quebec sovereigntists in Montreal , on National Holiday (Quebec) , 1964 , wherein a group of sovereigntists held placards reading `` Vanier vendu '' ( `` Vanier the sell-out '' ) and `` Vanier fou de la Reine '' ( `` Vanier , jester to the Queen '' ) .
Many saw National Holiday (Quebec) as an open act of courage , and the Prime Minister 's defiance impressed the electorate and contributed to his Liberal Party winning a significant majority the next day .
In June 2009 , National Holiday (Quebec) bands Lake of Stew and Bloodshot Bill , whose members are English-speaking and bilingual Quebeckers , were added to the program of a local celebration of Quebec 's National Day in Montreal called L'Autre St-Jean ( `` The Other St-Jean '' ) .
However , after public outrage from both the anglophone and francophone communities , these two bands were returned to the program when it was clarified that the bands were allowed to sing songs in English .
Historically , this festival has attempted to be more inclusive as groups in the past have sung in Creole and for the 2008 celebrations , Samian , `` the world 's first aboriginal Algonquin-language rapper '' , sang at Montreal 's celebration .

Ashland, Oregon is at 1949 ft above sea level in the foothills of the Siskiyou and Cascade ranges , about 15 miles ( 24 km ) north of the California border on Interstate 5 ( I-5 ) .

The Last Temptation of Christ ( or The Last Temptation ) is a novel written by Nikos Kazantzakis , first published in 1953 .
The central thesis of The Last Temptation of Christ is that Jesus , while free from sin , was still subject to fear , doubt , depression , reluctance , and lust .
Kazantzakis argues in the novel 's preface that by facing and conquering all of man 's weaknesses , Jesus struggled to do God 's will , without ever giving in to the temptations of the flesh .
The Xiongnu ( Xiongnu ; , `` Hunnu '' ; ; Guangyun ( Middle Chinese ) : ) were ancient nomadic-based people that formed a state or confederation .
The identity of the ethnic core of Xiongnu has been a subject of varied hypotheses , because only a few words , mainly titles and personal names , were preserved in the Chinese sources .
Ancient China often came in contact with was described as the `` Hsien-yün '' and the `` Jung '' nomadic people .
After Modu , later leaders formed a dualistic system of political organisation with the left and right branches of Xiongnu divided on a regional basis .
The chanyu or shan-yü -- supreme ruler equivalent to the Chinese `` Son of Heaven '' -- exercised direct authority over the central territory .
Yap , apparently describing the early period , places the Chanyu 's main camp north of Shanxi with the Wise King of the Left holding the area north of Beijing and the Wise King of the Right holding the Ordos Loop area as far as Gansu .
The peace settlement eventually reached between the parties included a Han princess given in marriage to the chanyu ( called heqin ) ; periodic gifts to the Xiongnu of silk , liquor , and rice ; equal status between the states ; and the Great Wall as mutual border .
This first treaty set the pattern for relations between the Han and the Xiongnu for sixty years .
His son and successor , the energetic Jiyu , known as the Laoshang Chanyu , continued his father 's expansionist policies .
In 121 BC , Xiongnu suffered another setback when Huo Qubing led a force of light cavalry westward out of Longxi and within six days fought his way through five Xiongnu kingdoms .
In 119 BC both Huo and Wei , each leading 50,000 cavalrymen and 100,000 footsoldiers ( in order to keep up with the mobility of Xiongnu , many of the non-cavalry Han soldiers were mobile infantrymen who traveled on horseback but fought on foot ) , and advancing along different routes , forced the chanyu and his court to flee north of the Gobi Desert .
Ban Chao was created the Marquess of Dingyuan ( 定遠侯 , i.e. , `` the Marquess who stabilized faraway places '' ) for his services to the Han Empire and returned to the capital Loyang at the age of 70 years old and died there in the year 102 .
The 12th Chanyu 's son fled east and , in 58BC , revolted .
The Great Wall of China continued to serve as the line of demarcation between Han and Xiongnu .
In 36 BC , a junior officer named Chen Tang , with the help of Gan Yanshou , protector-general of the Western Regions , assembled an expeditionary force that defeated him at the Battle of Zhizhi and sent his head as a trophy to Chang ` an .
Tensions were evident between the settled Chinese and practitioners of the nomadic way of life .
He travelled to Luoyang ( the Han capital ) to seek aid from the Han court , but at this time the Han court was in disorder from the clash between Grand General He Jin and the eunuchs , and the intervention of the warlord Dong Zhuo .
This was aimed at preventing the exiled Xiongnu in Shanxi from engaging in rebellion , and also allowed Cao Cao to use Xiongnu as auxiliaries in his cavalry .
In 311 , Xiongnu captured Luoyang , and with Xiongnu the Jin emperor Sima Chi ( Emperor Huai ) .
Since the early 19th century , Western scholars have proposed various language families or subfamilies as the affines of the language of Xiongnu .
Some scholars , including Paul Pelliot and Byambyn Rinchen , insisted on a Mongolic origin .
Well-preserved bodies in Xiongnu and pre-Xiongnu tombs in the Mongolian Republic and southern Siberia show both ` Mongoloid ' and ` Caucasian ' features but are predominantly Mongoloid with some admixture of European physical stock , nonetheless Xiongnu shared many cultural traits with their Indo-European neighbors , such as horse racing , sword worship .
Some scholars consider this a division between `` elite '' graves and `` commoner '' graves .
Also three Yakuts ' aDNA from the 15th century , and of two from the late 18th century were this haplogroup .
The similarity of the mitochondrial haplotype of the Pokrovsk subject with a woman of the Egyin Gol necropolis of the 2nd/3rd century AD ( mtDNA D haplogroup ) shows that this contact would have occurred by the end of the Xiongnu period , and possibly prior to the 3rd century BC .
The combined evidence demonstrates the close relationship between Xiongnu and the Siberian populations .
This results supports the hypothesis that the succession over time of different Turkic and Mongolian tribes in the current territory of Mongolia resulted in cultural rather than genetic exchanges .
According to the Uralistic literature the swift migration and disjunction of the Samoyedic peoples might be connected to a heavy warring in the region , probably due to the dissolution of the Xiongnu Empire in the period of the Battle of Ikh Bayan .
The mutation defining this haplogroup C-M130 , is restrained in North and Eastern-Asia and in America ( Bergen et al. 1998 .
A research project of 2007 ( Yi Chuan , 2007 ) was aimed at the genetic affinities between Tuoba Xianbei and Xiongnu populations .
Comparing with the published data of Xiongnu , the results indicated that the Tuoba Xianbei presented some close affinities to Xiongnu , which implied that there was a gene flow between Tuoba Xianbei and Xiongnu during the two southward migrations .
Within the Xiongnu culture more variety is visible from site to site than from `` era '' to `` era , '' in terms of the Chinese chronology , yet all form a whole that is distinct from that of the Han and other peoples of the non-Chinese north .
Scholar Sophia-Karin Psarras claims that Xiongnu images of animal predation , specifically tiger plus prey , is spiritual , representative of death and rebirth , and same-animal combat is representative of the acquisition of or maintenance of power .
Xiongnu consists mainly of engraved signs ( petroglyphs ) and only minimally of painted images .
Excavations conducted between 1924 -- 1925 , in Noin-Ula kurgans located in Selenga River in the northern Mongolian hills north of Ulan Bator , produced objects with over twenty carved characters , which were either identical or very similar to that of to the runic letters of the Turkic Orkhon script discovered in the Orkhon Valley .
From this a some scholars hold that the Xiongnu had a script similar to Eurasian runiform and this alphabet Xiongnu served as the basis for the ancient Turkic writing .

Counter-Strike is Counter-Strike a mod , Counter-Strike has developed Counter-Strike own community of script writers and mod creators .
There are some mods which affect gameplay heavily , such as Gun Game , where players start with a basic pistol and must score kills to receive better weapons , and Zombie Mod , where one team consists of and must `` spread the infection '' by killing the other team ( using only the knife ) .
On April 12 , 2000 , Valve announced that the Counter-Strike developers and Valve had teamed up .
On January 17 , 2008 , a Brazilian federal court order prohibiting all sales of Counter-Strike and EverQuest and imposing the immediate withdrawal of these from all stores began to be enforced .
The federal Brazilian judge Carlos Alberto Simões de Tomaz , of the Minas Gerais judiciary section , ordered the ban in October 2007 because , according to him , the games `` bring imminent stimulus to the subversion of the social order , attempting against the democratic and rightful state and against the public safety '' .

An adjective phrase ( or adjectival phrase ) is a phrase the head word of which is an adjective , e.g.
This definition is commonly used in English style guides for writing , where the terms attributive and adjective are frequently treated as synonyms , because attributive phrases are typically hyphenated , whereas predicative phrases generally are not , despite both modifying a noun .
The following trees illustrate the structure of head-initial adjective phrases , i.e. adjective phrases that have Adjectival phrase head on the left side of the phrase : The important aspect of these tree structures - regardless of whether one uses constituency or dependency to show the structure of phrases - is that Adjectival phrase are identified as adjective phrases by the label on the top node of each tree .

Nadia Comăneci overland journey took Nadia Comăneci through Hungary , Austria , and finally , to the United States .
Nadia Comăneci initial arrival in the United States generated some negative press , focusing on Nadia Comăneci penchant for heavy makeup and flashy clothes , and the fact that Nadia Comăneci constant companion Constantin Panait ( a Romanian exile who arranged Nadia Comăneci escape from Romania and initially exercised considerable control over Nadia Comăneci as Nadia Comăneci self-appointed business manager ) was a married father of four .
Together with Conner , Nadia Comăneci returned to Romania for the first time since Nadia Comăneci defection ( and since the fall of Communism and Ceaușescu 's death ) , and the couple were married in Bucharest on April 27 , 1996 .
On August 10 , 2007 , Nadia Comăneci was a `` mob '' participant on the American version of the game show 1 vs. 100 , and was not eliminated until the last 20 members of the mob were left .
Joseph Larmor and Hendrik Lorentz discovered that Maxwell 's equations , the cornerstone of electromagnetism , were invariant only by a certain change of time and length units .
Using only the isotropy of space and the symmetry implied by the principle of special relativity , one can show that the space-time transformations between inertial frames are either Galilean or Lorentzian .
General relativity uses the mathematics of differential geometry and tensors in order to describe gravitation as an effect of the geometry of spacetime .

Andromeda Galaxy and the Milky Way are thus expected to collide in about 4.5 billion years , although the details are uncertain since Andromeda 's tangential velocity with respect to the Milky Way is known to only within about a factor of two .

Hewitt developed an early interest in the radio and as a teenager accompanied Foster Hewitt father , W. A. Hewitt , on a trip to Detroit , Michigan to see a demonstration of radio technology sponsored by General Electric .
Foster Hewitt took a job with Independent Telephone Company , which manufactured radios , and left that job and university when Foster Hewitt father -- the sports editor of the Toronto Daily Star -- told Foster Hewitt that the Star was going to start its own radio station .
Hewitt 's first broadcast likely was February 16 , of a game between the Toronto Argonaut Rowing Club and the Kitchener Greenshirts .
Hewitt was part of the opening night ceremonies for Maple Leaf Gardens in November 1931 , and the broadcast gondola where Hewitt would broadcast from was brought into the plans with Foster Hewitt input , and the blessings of then Leafs owner Conn Smythe .
Foster Hewitt is the son of W. A. Hewitt , and the father of Bill Hewitt .
A nuclear war between the Soviet Union and the West has reduced much of the world to a barren wasteland .
`` Second Variety '' occurs in the aftermath of an extensive nuclear war between the Soviet Union ( sometimes referred to as Russia ) and the United Nations .
The three Soviets met by Major Hendricks -- Klaus , Rudi and a young woman named Tasso -- reveal that the entire Soviet army and command structure collapsed under the onslaught of the new robots .
The next morning , Hendricks and the two remaining Soviets return to the U.N. lines .
Hendricks , now suffering from a wounded arm and internal injuries , hopes to escape to the Moon Base .
