Stephanie Coontz , a professor of family history and the author of several books and essays about the history of marriage , says that this brief remark by Quayle about Murphy Brown `` kicked off more than a decade of outcries against the ` collapse of the family ' '' .
Julius Caesar ( , July 100 BC -- 15 March 44 BC ) was a Roman general , statesman , Consul and notable author of Latin prose .
Caesar 's conquest of Gaul , completed by 51 BC , extended Rome 's territory to the English Channel and the Rhine .
After assuming control of government , Julius Caesar began a program of social and governmental reforms , including the creation of the Julian calendar .
Caesar 's father , also called Gaius Julius Caesar , governed the province of Asia , and Julius Caesar sister Julia , Caesar 's aunt , married Gaius Marius , one of the most prominent figures in the Republic .
While there Julius Caesar is said to have encountered a statue of Alexander the Great , and realized with dissatisfaction Julius Caesar was now at an age when Alexander had the world at Julius Caesar feet , while Julius Caesar had achieved comparatively little .
Faced with the choice between a triumph and the consulship , Julius Caesar chose the consulship .
The term of Julius Caesar governorship , and thus Julius Caesar immunity from prosecution , was set at five years , rather than the usual one .
Caesar had four legions under Julius Caesar command , two of Julius Caesar provinces bordered on unconquered territory , and parts of Gaul were known to be unstable .
Julius Caesar advanced inland , and established a few alliances .
In 50 BC , the Senate , led by Pompey , ordered Caesar to disband Julius Caesar army and return to Rome because Julius Caesar term as governor had finished .
Caesar then became involved with an Egyptian civil war between the child pharaoh and Julius Caesar sister , wife , and co-regent queen , Cleopatra .
After spending the first months of 47 BC in Egypt , Caesar went to the Middle East , where Julius Caesar annihilated the king of Pontus ; Julius Caesar victory was so swift and complete that Julius Caesar mocked Pompey 's previous victories over such poor enemies .
The republican machinery had broken down under the weight of imperialism , the central government had become powerless , the provinces had been transformed into independent principalities under the absolute control of their governors , and the army had replaced the constitution as the means of accomplishing political goals .
At the Circus Maximus , two armies of war captives , each of 2,000 people , 200 horse and 20 elephants , fought to the death .
The calendar at the time was regulated by the movement of the moon , and this had resulted in a great deal of disorder .
To bring the calendar into alignment with the seasons , Julius Caesar decreed that three extra months be inserted into 46 BC ( the ordinary intercalary month at the end of February , and two extra months after November ) .
This addressed the underlying problem that had caused the Social War decades earlier , where individuals outside Rome and Italy were not considered `` Roman '' , and thus were not given full citizenship rights .
Mark Antony , having vaguely learned of the plot the night before from a terrified Liberator named Servilius Casca , and fearing the worst , went to head Julius Caesar off .
The plotters , however , had anticipated this and , fearing that Antony would come to Caesar 's aid , had arranged for Trebonius to intercept Julius Caesar just as Julius Caesar approached the portico of Theatre of Pompey , where the session was to be held , and detain Julius Caesar outside .
Caesar 's body was cremated , and on the site of Julius Caesar cremation the Temple of Caesar was erected a few years later ( at the east side of the main square of the Roman Forum ) .
In the ensuing chaos Mark Antony , Octavian ( later Augustus Caesar ) , and others fought a series of five civil wars , which would end in the formation of the Roman Empire .
The mob then attacked the houses of Brutus and Cassius , where they were repelled only with considerable difficulty , ultimately providing the spark for the Liberators ' civil war , fulfilling at least in part Antony 's threat against the aristocrats .
Octavian , aged only 18 when Caesar died , proved to have considerable political skills , and while Antony dealt with Decimus Brutus in the first round of the new civil wars , Octavian consolidated Julius Caesar tenuous position .
In 2003 , psychiatrist Harbour F. Hodder published what Julius Caesar termed as the `` Caesar Complex '' theory , arguing that Caesar was a sufferer of temporal lobe epilepsy and the debilitating symptoms of the condition were a factor in Caesar 's conscious decision to forgo personal safety in the days leading up to Julius Caesar assassination .
In Vulgar Latin , the plosive / k / before front vowels began , due to palatalization , to be pronounced as an affricate -- hence renderings like in Italian and in German regional pronunciations of Latin , as well as the title of Tsar .
According to Cicero , Bibulus , Gaius Memmius , and others ( mainly Caesar 's enemies ) , Julius Caesar had an affair with Nicomedes IV of Bithynia early in Julius Caesar career .
A favorite tactic used by the opposition was to accuse a popular political rival as living a Hellenistic lifestyle based on Greek and Eastern culture , where homosexuality and a lavish lifestyle were more acceptable than in Roman tradition .
From the second half of the 17th century onwards , a time of political and religious turmoil existed in the kingdoms .
Since the late Middle Ages , the Kingdoms of England and Scotland had been evolving towards a quasi-oligarchical or collegiate form of government in which the monarch was held to rule with the consensus of the land-owning upper classes .
The reigns of the last three Stuart Kings -- Charles I , Charles II and James II and VII -- were marked by growing Royal resistance to this developing consensual model of government .
In Seventeenth-century Europe , being a religious outsider meant being a political and social outsider as well .
Then in 1688 James 's second wife had a boy , bringing the prospect of a Catholic dynasty , and the `` Immortal Seven '' invited William and Mary to depose James .
William was allied to many Catholic states , including the Holy Roman Empire , and his elite force the Dutch Blue Guards had the papal banner with them .
Other clans , such as the powerful Camerons , were Episcopalian , and as staunch Jacobites as their allies , the Catholic MacDonalds .
Some Whigs , most obviously the Earl of Mar , reacted to political disappointments by joining the Jacobites , but while others were courted from 1692 onwards and indicated support , mostly this was just reinsurance in case the Jacobites came out on top .
The Tories were a more likely source of support given their commitment to church and king , but many were reluctant to trust the Church of England to a Catholic king .
Although small in number and varying from unemployed weavers looking for excitement to impoverished gentry like William Boyd , 4th Earl of Kilmarnock who served Charles as a colonel and became a general after the Battle of Falkirk , they contributed significantly to the daring that brought the Jacobites a prospect of success in their campaigns .
Even today , some Highland clans and regiments pass their drink over a glass of water during the Loyal Toast -- to the King Over the Water .
James II and VII had his viceroy Tyrconnell take action to secure Ireland for the Catholic cause , culminating in the Siege of Derry which began on 7 December 1688 .
The following 1 July , William and James met , accompanied by 50,000 of their men , at the Battle of the Boyne .
Under the terms , 14,000 Jacobite soldiers chose to continue fighting the Jacobite cause on the Continent , the so-called Flight of the Wild Geese ( 1,000 more chose to join the Williamite cause and 2,000 more chose to return to their homes ) .
In the minds of many , the `` King over the Water '' ( whom the Jacobites ' opponents called the Old Pretender ) became a mythical Arthurian figure , a good king who would one day return and put things right .
The failure of the ` Fifteen convinced the Jacobites that to overthrow the Hanoverians they needed the support of a major European power , and in an age when the Habsburg empire was collapsing and armies becoming professionalised this gave a lever to any country in dispute with Britain .
Francis Atterbury , Bishop of Rochester and a passionate High Tory , conspired with Mar who had been appointed `` Secretary of State '' by James Francis in France , for a rising to coincide with the general election in 1722 aiming to exploit public anger over the South Sea Bubble .
Finally , in a dispute with Marischal and the English conspirators in 1754 , a drunken Charles threatened to publish their names for having `` betrayed '' him , finally causing his supporters to abandon the Jacobite cause .
The Tenures Abolition Act ended the feudal bond of military service and the Heritable Jurisdictions Act removed the virtually sovereign power the chiefs had over their clan .
James Graham `` J. G. '' Ballard ( 15 November 1930 -- 19 April 2009 ) was an English novelist and short story writer .
The literary distinctiveness of J. G. Ballard work has given rise to the adjective '' '' , defined by the Collins English Dictionary as `` resembling or suggestive of the conditions described in J. G. Ballard 's novels and stories , especially dystopian modernity , bleak man-made landscapes and the psychological effects of technological , social or environmental developments '' .
Ballard was born and raised in the Shanghai International Settlement , an area under foreign control where people `` lived an American style of life '' .
Briefly attending the 1957 Science Fiction Convention in London , Ballard left disillusioned and demoralised and did not write another story for a year .
, and in 1970 Ballard organised an exhibition of crashed cars at the New Arts Laboratory , simply called `` Crashed Cars '' .
In both J. G. Ballard and the art exhibition , Ballard explored the sexual potential of car crashes , a preoccupation which culminated in the novel Crash in 1973 .
Many of J. G. Ballard earliest published works in the 1950s and 1960s were short stories .
Ballard 's parody of American politics , the pamphlet `` Why J. G. Ballard Want to Fuck Ronald Reagan '' , which was subsequently included as a chapter in J. G. Ballard experimental novel The Atrocity Exhibition , was photocopied and distributed by pranksters at the 1980 Republican National Convention .
Examples include albums such as Metamatic by John Foxx , various songs by Joy Division ( most famously `` Atrocity Exhibition '' from Closer ) , `` High Rise '' by Hawkwind , `` Miss the Girl '' by The Creatures ( based on Crash ) , `` Down in the Park '' by Gary Numan , `` Drowned World '' by Madonna and `` Warm Leatherette '' by The Normal .
Songwriters Trevor Horn and Bruce Woolley credit Ballard 's story `` The Sound-Sweep '' with inspiring The Buggles ' hit `` Video Killed the Radio Star '' , and the Buggles ' second album included a song entitled `` Vermillion Sands '' .
The role and status of journalism , along with mass media , have undergone profound changes resulting from the publication of news on the Internet .
This has created a shift away from print media consumption as people increasingly consume news on e-readers , smartphones , and other electronic devices , challenging news organizations to fully monetize digital news .
Notably , in the American media landscape , newsrooms have reduced Journalism staff and coverage as traditional media channels such as television grapple with declining audiences ; for instance , at CNN , once known for Journalism global , in-depth coverage , produced story packages were cut nearly in half from 2007 to 2012 .
Lippmann 's quarrel was with those very principles and institutions , for Journalism are the product of the pre-scientific and pre-historical viewpoint and what for him was a groundless natural rights political philosophy .
Dewey , on the other hand , believed the public was not only capable of understanding the issues created or responded to by the elite , Journalism was in the public forum that decisions should be made after discussion and debate .
While various existing codes have some differences , most share common elements including the principles of -- truthfulness , accuracy , objectivity , impartiality , fairness and public accountability -- as these apply to the acquisition of newsworthy information and Journalism subsequent dissemination to the public .
This is in stark contrast to the media climate prior to the 20th century , where the media market was dominated by smaller newspapers and pamphleteers who usually had an overt and often radical agenda , with no presumption of balance or objectivity .
A study of journalism in online video found that although most news videos adhere to traditional production practices ( e.g , editing and audio quality ) , Journalism tended to use more relaxed standards for content ( e.g. , use of sources , fairness ) .
One journalism magazine , Columbia Journal Review , has made Journalism a practice to reveal examples of executives who try to influence news coverage , of executives who do not abuse Journalism powers over journalists , and of journalists who resist such pressures .
Journalists who elect to cover conflicts , whether wars between nations or insurgencies within nations , often give up any expectation of protection by government , if not giving up their rights to protection by government .
The dispute over Tweeddale and Teviotdale does not appear to have damaged relations between Alexander and David , although it was unpopular in some quarters .
The dispute over the eastern marches does not appear to have caused lasting trouble between Alexander and Henry of England .
Alexander 's marriage with Henry 's illegitimate daughter Sybilla de Normandy may have occurred as early as 1107 , or as at late as 1114 .
John Calvin ( , born : 10 July 1509 -- 27 May 1564 ) was an influential French theologian and pastor during the Protestant Reformation .
Following John Calvin return , Calvin introduced new forms of church government and liturgy , despite the opposition of several powerful families in the city who tried to curb John Calvin authority .
The Reformed , Congregational , and Presbyterian churches , which look to John Calvin as the chief expositor of their beliefs , have spread throughout the world .
John Calvin father , Gérard Cauvin , had a prosperous career as the cathedral notary and registrar to the ecclesiastical court .
`` Being exceedingly alarmed at the misery into which John Calvin had fallen , and much more at that which threatened John Calvin in view of eternal death , John Calvin , duty bound , made it John Calvin first business to betake myself to your way , condemning John Calvin past life , not without groans and tears .
During this time , tensions rose at the Collège Royal ( later to become the Collège de France ) between the humanists/reformers and the conservative senior faculty members .
Calvin had only intended to stay a single night , but William Farel , a fellow French reformer residing in the city , implored a most reluctant Calvin to stay and assist John Calvin in work of reforming the church there -- it was John Calvin duty before God , Farel insisted .
Furthermore , France was taking an interest in forming an alliance with Geneva and as the two ministers were Frenchmen , councillors began to question their loyalty .
The council ordered John Calvin and Farel to use unleavened bread for the Easter eucharist ; in protest , the ministers did not administer communion during the Easter service .
Church attendance had dwindled and the political climate had changed ; as Bern and Geneva quarrelled over land , their alliance frayed .
By 1547 , opposition to John Calvin and other French refugee ministers had grown to constitute the majority of the syndics , the civil magistrates of Geneva .
Calling him a `` Spanish-Portuguese '' , suspecting and accusing John Calvin of John Calvin recently proved Jewish converso origin .
The council decided to re-examine the Ordonnances and on 18 September it voted in support of John Calvin -- excommunication was within the jurisdiction of the Consistory .
Finally , on 22 January 1555 , the council announced the decision of the Swiss churches : the original Ordonnances were to be kept and the Consistory was to regain its official powers .
However , a doctrinal conflict had developed between Luther and Zurich reformer Huldrych Zwingli on the interpretation of the eucharist .
John Calvin actively participated in the polemics that were exchanged between the Lutheran and Reformed branches of the Reformation movement .
John Calvin took steps toward rapprochement with Bullinger by signing the Consensus Tigurinus , a concordat between the Zurich and Geneva churches .
Between 1555 and 1562 , more than 100 ministers were sent to France .
Calvin developed John Calvin theology in John Calvin biblical commentaries as well as John Calvin sermons and treatises , but the most concise expression of John Calvin views is found in John Calvin magnum opus , the Institutes of the Christian Religion .
John Calvin defends the trinitarian view of God and , in a strong polemical stand against the Catholic Church , argues that images of God lead to idolatry .
For John Calvin , the whole course of Christ 's obedience to the Father removed the discord between humanity and God .
In the third book , John Calvin describes how the spiritual union of Christ and humanity is achieved .
Fellow theologians who followed the Augustinian tradition on this point included Thomas Aquinas and Martin Luther , though Calvin 's formulation of the doctrine went further than the tradition that went before John Calvin .
The principle , in Calvin 's words , is that `` All are not created on equal terms , but some are preordained to eternal life , others to eternal damnation ; and , accordingly , as each has been created for one or other of these ends , we say that John Calvin has been predestinated to life or to death '' .
In the following year , Joachim Westphal , a Gnesio-Lutheran pastor in Hamburg , condemned John Calvin and Zwingli as heretics in denying the eucharistic doctrine of the union of Christ 's body with the elements .
Ibycus ( floruit : 2nd half of 6th century BC ) was an Ancient Greek lyric poet , a citizen of Rhegium in Magna Graecia , probably active at Samos during the reign of the tyrant Polycrates and numbered by the scholars of Hellenistic Alexandria in the canonical list of nine lyric poets .
Eusebius recorded Ibycus first experience of fame ( `` agnoscitur '' ) somewhere between 542 and 537 BC and this better fits the period of Polycrates ' reign .
It is not certain that Ibycus ever in fact composed monody ( lyrics for solo performance ) , but the emotional and erotic quality of Ibycus verse , and the fact that Ibycus colleague in Samos was Anacreon , who did compose monody , suggest that Ibycus did too .
In the poem , Ibycos parades the names and characteristics of heroes familiar from Homer 's Trojan epic , as types of people the poem is not about , until Ibycus reaches the final stanza , where Ibycus reveals that Ibycus real subject is Polycrates , whom Ibycus says Ibycus will immortalize in verse .
Didymus Chalcenterus ( Latin ; Greek Didymos chalkenteros , `` Didymus bronze-guts '' ) , ca. 63 BCE to 10 CE , was a Greek scholar and grammarian who flourished in the time of Cicero and Augustus .
The surname `` bronze-guts '' came from Didymus Chalcenterus indefatigable industry : Didymus Chalcenterus was said to have written so many books that Didymus Chalcenterus was unable to recollect what Didymus Chalcenterus had written in earlier ones , and so often contradicted Didymus Chalcenterus .
Didymus Chalcenterus is known to have written on Greek lyric poets , notably Bacchylides and Pindar , and on drama ; the better part of the Pindar and Sophocles scholia originated with Didymus .
This confirms that Didymus Chalcenterus was not an original researcher , but a scrupulous compiler who made many quotations from earlier writers , and who was prepared to comment about chronology and history , as well as rhetoric and style .
This recording session was financed by Warhol and Columbia Records ' sales executive Norman Dolph , who also acted as an engineer with John Licata .
With the affirmation of a label , three of the songs , `` I 'm Waiting for the Man '' , `` Venus in Furs '' and `` Heroin '' , were re-recorded in two days at T.T.G.
Reed , a fan of poets and authors such as Raymond Chandler , Nelson Algren , William S. Burroughs , Allen Ginsberg , and Hubert Selby , Jr. , saw no reason why the content in their works could n't translate well to rock and roll music .
An English major who studied for a B.A. at Syracuse University , Reed said in an interview that he thought joining the two ( gritty subject matter and music ) was `` obvious '' .
A common misperception is that `` All Tomorrow 's Parties '' was written by Reed at Warhol 's request ( as stated in Victor Bockris and Gerard Malanga 's Velvet Underground biography Up-Tight : The Velvet Underground Story ) .
Cale , who was influenced greatly by his work with La Monte Young , John Cage and the early Fluxus movement , encouraged the use of alternative ways of producing sound in music .
Early copies of The Velvet Underground & Nico invited the owner to `` Peel slowly and see '' ; peeling back the banana skin revealed a flesh-colored banana underneath .
In January 2012 , the `` Velvet Underground '' business partnership ( of which John Cale and Lou Reed are general partners ) sued The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts , Inc. in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York after the Foundation licensed the cover 's banana design to Incase Designs for use on a line of iPhone and iPad cases .
Frustrated by The Velvet Underground & Nico year-long delay and unsuccessful release , Lou Reed 's relationship with Andy Warhol grew tense until Reed finally fired Warhol as manager in favor of Steve Sesnick .
According to the essay by music critic and historian Richie Unterberger contained within the set , the source for the show is the only audio tape of acceptable quality recording during singer Nico 's tenure in the band .
Since Harun was intellectually , politically and militarily resourceful , Harun al-Rashid life and the court over which Harun al-Rashid held sway have been the subject of many tales : some are claimed to be factual but most are believed to be fictitious .
Among what is known to be fictional is The Book of One Thousand and One Nights , which contains many stories that are fantasized by Harun 's magnificent court and even Harun al-Rashid Harun al-Rashid .
It stayed there for three years , when Harun al-Rashid , happening to pass through Baghdad from the East , gave command for the remains to be taken down and burned .
On the day of accession , Harun al-Rashid son al-Ma ` mun was born , and al-Amin some little time later : the latter was the son of Zubaida , a granddaughter of al-Mansur ( founder of the city of Baghdad ) ; so Harun al-Rashid took precedence over the former , whose mother was a Persian slave-girl .
Rashid appointed Harun al-Rashid as Harun al-Rashid vizier with full executive powers , and , for seventeen years , this man Yahya and Harun al-Rashid sons , served Rashid faithfully in whatever assignment Harun al-Rashid entrusted to them .
Al-Rashid virtually dismembered the empire by apportioning it between Harun al-Rashid two sons al-Amin and al-Ma ` mun ( with Harun al-Rashid third son , al-Qasim , being belatedly added after them ) .
On awakening and being informed of this , Harun al-Rashid said Ishaq ibn Ibrahim had received a supernatural visitation .
A corona ( Latin , ` crown ' ) is a type of plasma `` atmosphere '' of the Sun or other celestial body , extending millions of kilometres into space , most easily seen during a total solar eclipse , but also observable in a coronagraph .
The fact that the Sun has a million-degree corona was first discovered by Gotrian in 1939 and Bengt Edlén in 1941 by identifying the coronal lines ( observed since 1869 ) as transitions from low-lying metastable levels of the ground configuration of highly ionised metals ( the green FeXIV line at 5303 Å , but also the red line FeX at 6374 Å ) .
The F-corona ( F for Fraunhofer ) is created by sunlight bouncing off dust particles , and is observable because Corona light contains the Fraunhofer absorption lines that are seen in raw sunlight ; the F-corona extends to very high elongation angles from the Sun , where Corona is called the zodiacal light .
The average temperature is between two and four million Kelvin , while the density goes from 109 to 1010 particle per cm3 .
Loops of magnetic flux well up from the solar body and fill with hot solar plasma .
The plasma pressure can be calculated by the state equation of a perfect gas , where is the particle number density , the Boltzmann constant and Corona temperature .
These are wide zones of the Sun where the magnetic field is unipolar and opens towards the interplanetary space .
These are enormous loops of coronal material traveling outward from the Sun at over a million kilometers per hour , containing roughly 10 times the energy of the solar flare or prominence that accompanies them .
All the instruments registered the storm which is considered as one of the largest solar activity events observed by SOHO and maybe since the advent of space-based solar observations .
The composition is the same as the one in the Sun 's interior , mainly hydrogen , but completely ionized , thence protons and electrons , and a small fraction of the other atoms in the same percentages as Corona are present in the photosphere .
This fact has relevant physical consequences either on radiative processes ( that are very different from the photospheric radiative processes ) , or on thermal conduction .
The amount of power required to heat Corona can easily be calculated as the difference between coronal radiative losses and heating by thermal conduction toward the chromosphere through the transition region .
Waves in plasmas are notoriously difficult to understand and describe analytically , but computer simulations , carried out by Thomas Bogdan and colleagues in 2003 , seem to show that Alfvén waves can transmute into other wave modes at the base of Corona , providing a pathway that can carry large amounts of energy from the photosphere into Corona and then dissipate it as heat .
In Corona , magnetic field lines are normally tied to individual pieces of matter , so that the topology of the magnetic field remains the same : if a particular north and south magnetic pole are connected by a single field line , then even if Corona is stirred or if the magnets are moved around , that field line will continue to connect those particular poles .
As per studies performed in 2010 at the National Centre for Atmospheric Research in Colorado , in collaboration with the Lockheed Martin 's Solar and Astrophysics Laboratory ( LMSAL ) and the Institute of Theoretical Astrophysics of the University of Oslo , a new class of spicules ( TYPE II ) discovered in 2007 , which travel faster ( up to 100 km/s ) and have shorter lifespans can account for the problem .
Didymus the Blind ( alternatively spelled Dedimus or Didymous ) ( c. 313 -- 398 ) was a Coptic Church theologian of Alexandria , whose famous Catechetical School Didymus the Blind led for about half a century .
Despite Didymus the Blind impaired vision , Didymus the Blind memory was so powerful that Didymus the Blind mastered dialectics and geometry , subjects whose study usually benefits appreciably from sight .
Rufinus recounts that upon entering the service of the Church , Didymus became ' a teacher in the Church school ' , having been ` approved by Bishop Athanasius ' and other learned churchmen .
It used to be assumed that this meant Didymus the Blind was placed at the head of the Catechetical School of Alexandria which had flourished under Clement and Origen .
Didymus the Blind counted among Didymus the Blind pupils Palladius , Rufinus , Evagrius , and Jerome , who mentions in Didymus the Blind letters that Didymus the Blind `` wrote to Didymus calling Didymus the Blind Didymus the Blind master '' and defends this tutelage as one of a man `` both old and learned '' .
Jerome , generally spoke of Didymus not as the blind but as `` the Seeing '' , or `` the Seer , '' since although blind , Didymus the Blind writings showed great insight into God .
In 553 the Second Council of Constantinople condemned Didymus the Blind works , along with those of Origen and Evagrius , but not Didymus the Blind person .
However , the view that the work preserved as books 4 and 5 of Basil 's Against Eunomius is by Didymus is increasingly contentious .
Modern knowledge of Didymus , though , has been greatly increased by a group of 6th or 7th century papyrus codices discovered in 1941 at a munitions dump near Toura , Egypt ( south of Cairo ) .
Besides the gift of having a mind like a concordance , Didymus the Blind also shows familiarity with philosophical terms and categories of the Stoics , Epicureans , and Pythagoreans ( from whom , with Philo , Didymus the Blind derives Didymus the Blind occasional number symbolism hermeneutic ) .
Jerome , who requested Didymus the Blind commentary and considered Didymus the Blind a mentor , is still baffled by Didymus 's use of what Didymus the Blind considered apocryphal works .
, and Didymus the Blind belief that divine punishment is remedial in nature .
`` Paeon '' was also the name of a divine physician and an epithet of Apollo .
There was in earlier Greece a class of seers and purificatory priests which in all essentials fulfilled this function .
Paean was sung before the resuming of the naval battle between the Corcyraeans and Corinthians in a war leading up to the Peloponnesian War , implying that it might have been a common practice .
Typically Paean was in the Dorian mode ( note that the Ancient Greek Dorian was different from the modern Dorian mode ; see musical mode ) , and was accompanied by the kithara , which was Apollo 's instrument .
The fragment by Limenius has been dated to 128 BC ; the one by Athenaios may have been composed in the same year , or ten years earlier .
The basic principles of general semantics , which include time-binding , are described in the publication Science and Sanity , published in 1933 .
Many devotees and critics of Korzybski reduced Alfred Korzybski rather complex system to a simple matter of what Alfred Korzybski said about the verb form `` is '' of the more general verb `` to be '' .
Alfred Korzybski system , however , is based primarily on such terminology as the different `` orders of abstraction , '' and formulations such as `` consciousness of abstracting '' .
Alfred Korzybski thought that certain uses of the verb `` to be '' , called the `` is of identity '' and the `` is of predication '' , were faulty in structure , e.g. , a statement such as , `` Elizabeth is a fool '' ( said of a person named `` Elizabeth '' who has done something that we regard as foolish ) .
Note that this premise uses the phrase `` is not '' , a form of `` to be '' ; this and many other examples show that Alfred Korzybski did not intend to abandon `` to be '' as such .

In the contest for patronship of Athens between Poseidon and Athena , the salt spring on the Acropolis where Poseidon 's trident struck was known as the sea of Erechtheus .
The Odyssey ( VII .81 ) already records that Athena returned to Athens and `` entered the strong-built house of Erechtheus '' .
That Poseidon and Erechtheus were two names at Athens for the same figure ( see below ) was demonstrated in the cult at the Erechtheum , where there was a single altar , a single priest and sacrifices were dedicated to Poseidon erechtheus , Walter Burkert observed , adding `` An historian would say that a Homeric , pan-Hellenic name has been superimposed on an autochthonous , non-Greek name '' .
Erechtheus Erechtheus divided the royal power possessed by Pandion , Erechtheus taking the physical rule but Butes taking the priesthood of Athena and Poseidon , this right being passed on to his descendants .

The introduction to the whole work , treating of the value of philosophy and of philosophical sects , is lost , with the exception of the concluding portion ; the second book is little more than a fragment , and the third and fourth have been amalgamated by altering the original sections .

Some of the missing parts of the second book ( chapters 15 , 31 , 33 , and 46 ) have , however , been recovered from a 14th-century gnomology .
Herse ( `` dew '' ) is a figure in Greek mythology , daughter of Cecrops , sister to Aglauros and Pandrosos .
Some authors , such as Ovid in his Metamorphoses and Ars Amatoria , wrote a different end for Herse and Aglauros .

Hiero I of Syracuse ( Ἱέρων in Greek ) was the son of Deinomenes , the brother of Gelon and tyrant of Syracuse in Sicily from 478 to 467 BC .
Hiero I of Syracuse most important military achievement was the defeat of the Etruscans and Carthaginians at the Battle of Cumae ( 474 BC ) , by which Hiero I of Syracuse saved the Greeks of Campania from Etruscan domination .
Hiero I of Syracuse won the chariot race at Delphi in 470 ( a victory celebrated in Pindar 's first Pythian ode ) and at Olympia in 468 ( this , Hiero I of Syracuse greatest victory , was commemorated in Bacchylides ' third victory ode ) .
Other odes dedicated to Hiero I of Syracuse include Pindar 's first Olympian Ode , Hiero I of Syracuse second and third Pythian odes , and Bacchylides ' fourth and fifth victory odes .
The tyranny at Syracuse lasted only a year or so after Hiero I of Syracuse death .
Zenobius is also said to have been the author of a Greek translation of the Latin prose author Sallust , which has been lost , and of a birthday poem on the emperor Hadrian .

Zhuoyun , however , is in league with Songlian 's personal maid , Yan ` er ( played by Kong Lin ) who finds and reveals a pair of bloodied undergarments , suggesting that Songlian had recently had her period , and discovers the pregnancy is a fraud .
Yan ` er falls sick and ultimately dies after being taken to the hospital .

Aulus Gellius ( ca. 125 -- after 180 AD ) was a Latin author and grammarian , who was probably born and certainly brought up in Rome .
The work , deliberately devoid of sequence or arrangement , is divided into twenty books .
A volume of selections , with notes and vocabulary , was published by Nall ( London , 1888 ) .
Car audio was a $ 150 `` option '' for 1956 Chrysler and Imperial cars , which hit the showroom floor on October 21 , 1955 .

However , Car audio were not well suited to the extremes of temperature and vibration which are a normal part of the environment of an automobile .

Many head units also feature a DSP component , and equalization component ( such as bass and treble controls ) , or a control interface for another feature on the car ( such as a back-up/parking camera , navigation system , trip odometer , etc. ) .
Sound deadening material is often used in the door cavities and boot/trunk area to damp excess vibration of the panels in the car in response to loud subwoofer bass tones , especially the boot/trunk .

Although a planned economy may be based on either centralized or decentralized forms of economic planning , Planned economy usually refers to a centrally planned economy .
An economy based on economic planning ( either through the state , an association of worker cooperatives or another economic entity that has jurisdiction over the means of production ) appropriates Planned economy resources as needed , so that allocation comes in the form of internal transfers rather than market transactions involving the purchasing of assets by one government agency or firm by another .
Another example of this is the utilization of dirigisme , both of which were practiced in France and Great Britain after the Second World War .
Some make the distinction that in a `` command economy '' , enterprises need not follow Planned economy or be coordinated through planning - the dominant coordinating mechanism comes in the form of Planned economy from higher authorities .
Still , most of the economic hardship that struck many of the former East Bloc countries and the post-Soviet states comes from the program of shock therapy .
Economist Robin Hahnel notes that , even if central planning overcame Planned economy inherent inhibitions of incentives and innovation , it would nevertheless be unable to maximize economic democracy and self-management , which he believes are concepts that are more intellectually coherent , consistent and just than mainstream notions of economic freedom .
Studies of Eastern European planned economies in the 1950s and 1960s by both American and Eastern European economists found that , contrary to expectations , Planned economy showed greater fluctuations in output than market economies during the same period .
The World State in Aldous Huxley 's Brave New World and Airstrip One in George Orwell 's Nineteen Eighty Four are both fictional examples of Planned economy , albeit with diametrically opposed aims : The former is a consumer economy designed to engender productivity while the latter is a shortage economy designed as an agent of totalitarian social control .
In Ursula K. Le Guin 's science fiction novel The Dispossessed , published 1974 , mainstream capitalist and state socialist economies on the planet Urras are contrasted with an anarchist self-managed economy on Planned economy orbiting twin Anarres .
Antoninus Pius , hearing of Marcus Cornelius Fronto fame , appointed Marcus Cornelius Fronto tutor to his adopted sons Marcus Aurelius and Lucius Verus .

One Dobson unit refers to a layer of gas that would be 10 µm thick under standard temperature and pressure , sometimes referred to as a ` milli-atmo-centimeter ' .
Also , from direct measurements over Antarctica , a column ozone level of less than 220 Dobson Units is a result of the ozone loss from chlorine and bromine compounds .

However , this unusual fission-fusion social structure , `` in which portions of the parent group may on a regular basis separate from and then rejoin the rest , '' is highly variable in terms of which particular individual chimpanzees congregate at a given time .
Chimpanzees have been described as highly territorial and are known to kill other chimps , although Margaret Power wrote in her 1991 book The Egalitarians that the field studies from which the aggressive data came , Gombe and Mahale , use artificial feeding systems that increased aggression in the chimpanzee populations studied , so might not reflect innate characteristics of Common chimpanzee as a whole .
The survival and emotional health of the young is dependent on maternal care .
When in an aggressive mode , a chimp will swagger bipedally , hunched over and arms waving , in an attempt to exaggerate Common chimpanzee size .
Duplications of small parts of chromosomes have been the major source of differences between human and chimp genetic material ; about 2.7 % of the corresponding modern genomes represent differences , produced by gene duplications or deletions , during the approximately four to six million years since humans and chimps diverged from their common evolutionary ancestor .
Some of these attacks are presumed to be due to chimpanzees being intoxicated ( from alcohol obtained from rural brewing operations ) and mistaking human children for the Western red colobus , one of their favorite meals .
Two types of human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) infect humans : HIV-1 and HIV-2 .
Both types originated in west and central Africa , jumping from primates to humans .
One powerful technique for generating digital elevation models is interferometric synthetic aperture radar where two passes of a radar satellite ( such as RADARSAT-1 or TerraSAR-X or Cosmo SkyMed ) , or a single pass if the satellite is equipped with two antennas ( like the SRTM instrumentation ) , collect sufficient data to generate a digital elevation map tens of kilometers on a side with a resolution of around ten meters .

Henry Howard, Earl of Surrey , Earl of Surrey , KG ( 1516/1517 -- 19 January 1547 ) , was an English aristocrat , and one of the founders of English Renaissance poetry .
In 1532 Henry Howard, Earl of Surrey accompanied Henry Howard, Earl of Surrey first cousin Anne Boleyn , the King , and the Duke of Richmond to France , staying there for more than a year as a member of the entourage of Francis I of France .
Henry VIII , consumed by paranoia and increasingly ill , became convinced that Surrey had planned to usurp the crown from Henry Howard, Earl of Surrey son Edward .
The King had Surrey imprisoned - with Henry Howard, Earl of Surrey father - sentenced to death on 13 January 1547 , and beheaded for treason on 19 January 1547 ( Henry Howard, Earl of Surrey father survived impending execution only by it being set for the day after the king happened to die , though Henry Howard, Earl of Surrey remained imprisoned ) .
Doppler radar does this by beaming a microwave signal towards a desired target and listening for Doppler radar reflection , then analyzing how the frequency of the returned signal has been altered by the object 's motion .
The Doppler effect ( or Doppler shift ) , named after Austrian physicist Christian Doppler who proposed Doppler radar in 1842 , is the difference between the observed frequency and the emitted frequency of a wave for an observer moving relative to the source of the waves .
Thus , the relative difference in velocity between a source and an observer is what gives rise to the doppler effect .
Continuous-broadcast , or FM , radar was developed during World War II for the use by United States Navy aircraft to support night combat operation .
By directly measuring the movement of the ground with Doppler radar , and then comparing this to the airspeed returned from the aircraft instruments , the wind speed could be accurately determined for the first time .
Normally it is one or the other ; a radar designed for detecting targets from zero to Mach 2 does not have a high resolution in speed , while a radar designed for high resolution velocity measurements does not have a wide range of speeds .
This was made possible by the use of circular polarization and a multi-port waveguide section operating at X band .
PD radars operate at too high a PRF to use a transmit-receive gas filled switch , and most use solid-state devices to protect the receiver low noise amplifier when the transmitter is fired .
Other terms sometimes used are less developed countries ( LDCs ) , least economically developed countries ( LEDCs ) , Developing country or Third World nations , and `` non-industrialized nations '' .
The term implies inferiority of a ` developing country ' or ` undeveloped country ' compared to a developed country , which many countries dislike .
Currently incurable , this disease is one of the most common inherited neurological disorders affecting approximately 1 in 2,500 people equating to approximately 23,000 people in the United Kingdom and 125,000 people in the USA .
Wasting of muscle tissue of the lower parts of the legs may give rise to a `` stork leg '' or `` inverted bottle '' appearance .
Weakness in the hands and forearms occurs in many people later in life as the disease progresses .
Loss of touch sensation in the feet , ankles and legs , as well as in the hands , wrists and arms is characteristic in various types of the disease .
Neuropathic pain is often a symptom of CMT , though , like other symptoms of CMT , Charcot–Marie–Tooth disease presence and severity varies from case to case .
In ancient Roman religion , Ceres (mythology) was a goddess of agriculture , grain crops , fertility and motherly relationships .
She was originally the central deity in Rome 's so-called plebeian or Aventine Triad , then was paired with her daughter Proserpina in what Romans described as `` the Greek rites of Ceres (mythology) '' .
In the ancient sacrum cereale a priest , probably the Flamen Cerialis , invoked Ceres (mythology) ( and probably Tellus ) along with twelve specialised , minor assistant-gods to secure divine protection and assistance at each stage of the grain cycle , beginning shortly before the Feriae Sementivae .
Pliny the Elder `` notes that the most auspicious wood for wedding torches came from the spina alba , the may tree , which bore many fruits and hence symbolised fertility '' .
Varro describes the sacrifice of a pig as `` a worthy mark of weddings '' because `` our women , and especially nurses '' call the female genitalia porcus ( pig ) .
Spaeth ( 1996 ) believes Ceres (mythology) may have been included in the sacrificial dedication , because she is closely identified with Tellus and `` bears the laws '' of marriage .
In the most solemn form of marriage , confarreatio , the bride and groom shared a cake made of far , the ancient wheat-type particularly associated with Ceres (mythology) .
Ceres (mythology) was patron and protector of plebeian laws , rights and Tribunes .
The official decrees of the Senate ( senatus consulta ) were placed in Ceres (mythology) ' Temple , under the guardianship of Ceres (mythology) and her aediles .
This may represent a secondary or late function of the mundus , attested no earlier than the Late Republican Era , by Varro .
In Plutarch , the digging of such a pit to receive first-fruits and small quantities of native soil was an Etruscan colonial city-foundation rite .
The cause or causes of the fire remained uncertain , but Ceres (mythology) disastrous extent was taken as a sign of offense against Juno , Vulcan , and Ceres-with-Proserpina , who were all were given expiatory cult .
Champlin ( 2003 ) perceives the expiations to Vulcan and Ceres (mythology) in particular as attempted populist appeals by the ruling emperor , Nero .
Ceres (mythology) ' known mythology is indistinguishable from Demeter 's : `` When Ceres (mythology) sought through all the earth with lit torches for Proserpina , who had been seized by Dis Pater , she called her with shouts where three or four roads meet ; from this it has endured in her rites that on certain days a lamentation is raised at the crossroads everywhere by the matronae '' .
Ceres (mythology) had strong mythological and cult connections with Sicily , especially at Henna ( Enna ) , on whose `` miraculous plain '' flowers bloomed throughout the year .
No images of Ceres (mythology) survive from her pre-Aventine cults ; the earliest date to the middle Republic , and show the Hellenising influence of Demeter 's iconography .
Some Imperial coin images depict important female members of the Imperial family as Ceres (mythology) , or with some of her attributes .
The famine ended and Rome 's plebeian citizen-soldiery co-operated in the conquest of the Latins .
Early Roman initiates at Eleusis in Greece included Sulla and Cicero ; thereafter many Emperors were initiated , including Hadrian , who founded an Eleusinian cult centre in Rome Ceres (mythology) .
A coin of Sulla shows Ceres (mythology) on one side , on the other a ploughman with yoked oxen : the images , accompanied by the legend `` conditor '' , claim his rule ( a military dictatorship ) as regenerative and divinely justified .
The traditional , Cerean virtues of provision and nourishment were symbolically extended to Imperial family members with coinage that showed Claudius ' mother Antonia as Augusta with corona spicea .
The relationship between the reigning emperor , empress and Ceres (mythology) was formalised in titles such as Augusta mater agrorum ( `` The august mother of the fields ) and Ceres (mythology) Augusta .
A poem about Ceres (mythology) and humanity features in Dmitri 's confession to his brother Alexei in Dostoevsky 's The Brothers Karamazov , Part 1 , Book 3 , Chapter 3 .
Ceres (mythology) is patron and protector of plebeian laws , rights and Tribunes .
Ceres (mythology) is guardian deity of seed-corn , an essential deity in the establishment and agricultural prosperity of cities , and a door-warden of the underworld 's afterlife .
Ceres (mythology) is Augusta mater agrorum ( `` The august mother of the fields ) and Ceres Augusta .
In Greek mythology , Alcyone ( , Halkyónē ) was the daughter of Aeolus , either by Enarete or Aegiale .
Ovid and Hyginus both also make the metamorphosis the origin of the etymology for '' , '' the seven days in winter when storms never occur .
Alcyone proper meaning , however , is that of a lucky break , or a bright interval set in the midst of adversity ; just as the days of calm and mild weather are set in the height of winter for the sake of the kingfishers ' egglaying .
Following `` pay-for-play '' scandals at California , USC , UCLA and Washington , the PCC disbanded in 1959 .
On July 1 , 2011 the Pac-12 assumed Pacific-12 Conference current alignment when both Colorado and Utah officially joined as full members .
Various polls , formulas , and other third-party systems have been used to determine national championships , not all of which are universally accepted .
The two newest members , Colorado and Utah , have a football rivalry as well that had been dormant since 1962 - both were conference rivals previously in the Rocky Mountain Athletic Conference ( now a Division II conference ) , and later the now-defunct Mountain States Conference ( also known as Pacific-12 Conference ) .
All of the California schools consider each other major rivals , due to the culture clash between Northern and Southern California .
Oregon , Oregon State , Washington , and Washington State all consider each other major rivals due to the proximity and long history .
Arizona and New Mexico have a recently renewed rivalry game , based upon when they were both members of the WAC and both states were longtime territories before being admitted as states in 1912 .
In 2010 , the last season before the arrival of Colorado and Utah , Pacific-12 Conference was the Big East .
The schedule consisted of one home and away game against the two schools in each region , plus the game against the primary rival .
Arizona , Arizona State , and USC have long and successful histories in baseball and all have won national titles in the sport .
The most intense series is widely regarded to be the `` Basebrawl '' series between USC and Arizona State in 1990 .
The teams are paired as follows : USC and UCLA ( the L.A. teams ) , Arizona and Arizona State ( the Arizona teams ) , California and Stanford ( the Bay Area teams ) , Washington and Washington State ( the Washington teams ) , Oregon and Oregon State ( the Oregon teams ) , and Colorado and Utah ( the Rocky Mountain teams ) .
To make scheduling simpler for men and women 's basketball ( a sport in which each conference member uses a single venue for both teams ' home games ) , the schedule for women 's basketball is the opposite of the men 's schedule .
Although less common , Central pontine myelinolysis may also present in patients with a history of chronic alcoholism or other conditions related to decreased liver function .
In the context of chronic low plasma sodium , the brain 's cells ( neurons and glia ) adapt by taking in a small amount of water ; the net effect is to move water out of the interstitium and equilibrate ( or nearly so ) the intracellular and extracellular tonicities .
David Attenborough , OM CH CVO CBE FRS FZS FSA ( born 8 May 1926 ) is an English broadcaster and naturalist .
David Attenborough is best known for writing and presenting the nine Life series , in conjunction with the BBC Natural History Unit , which collectively form a comprehensive survey of all life on the planet .
and Song Hunter , a series about folk music presented by Alan Lomax .
With a mission to make BBC Two 's output diverse and different from that offered by other networks , David Attenborough began to establish a portfolio of programmes that defined the channel 's identity for decades to come .
Under David Attenborough tenure , music , the arts , entertainment , archaeology , experimental comedy , travel , drama , sport , business , science and natural history all found a place in the weekly schedules .
Programmes David Attenborough commissioned included Man Alive , Call David Attenborough Bluff , Chronicle , Life , One Pair of Eyes , The Old Grey Whistle Test , Monty Python 's Flying Circus and The Money Programme .
By treating David Attenborough subject seriously and researching the latest discoveries , Attenborough and David Attenborough production team gained the trust of the scientific community , who responded by allowing David Attenborough to feature their subjects in David Attenborough programmes .
David Attenborough narrated every episode of Wildlife on One , a BBC One wildlife series which ran for 253 episodes between 1977 and 2005 .
At its peak , it drew a weekly audience of eight to ten million , and the 1987 episode `` Meerkats United '' was voted the best wildlife documentary of all time by BBC viewers .
Alastair Fothergill , a senior producer with whom David Attenborough had worked on The Trials of Life and Life in the Freezer , was making The Blue Planet ( 2001 ) , the Unit 's first comprehensive series on marine life .
This is a series of very brief radio broadcasts , each on a different bird , and is normally broadcast at around 5 : 58 a.m. ( just before the Today programme ) on weekdays , and at a later time on Sundays .
Life on Air ( 2002 ) examined the legacy of David Attenborough work and Attenborough the Controller ( 2002 ) focused on David Attenborough time in charge of BBC Two .
and the following year David Attenborough won The Culture Shows Living Icon Award .
The last episode of The Living Planet , for example , focuses almost entirely on humans ' destruction of the environment and ways that it could be stopped or reversed .
In 2002 David Attenborough joined an effort by leading clerics and scientists to oppose the inclusion of creationism in the curriculum of UK state-funded independent schools which receive private sponsorship , such as the Emmanuel Schools Foundation .
In 2009 David Attenborough stated that the Book of Genesis , by saying that the world was there for people to dominate , had taught generations that they can `` dominate '' the environment , and that this has resulted in the devastation of vast areas of the environment .
David Attenborough strongly opposes creationism and its offshoot `` intelligent design '' , saying that a survey that found a quarter of science teachers in state schools believe that creationism should be taught alongside evolution in science lessons was `` really terrible '' .
PSB , to David Attenborough , is not about selecting individual programme strands here or there , financing them from some outside source and then foisting them upon commercial networks .
The licence fee is the basis on which the BBC is based and if you destroy it , broadcasting ... becomes a wasteland .
David Attenborough most influential work , 1979 's Life on Earth , launched a strand of nine authored documentaries with the BBC Natural History Unit which shared the Life moniker and spanned 30 years .
In the 1950s and 1960s David Attenborough published work included accounts of David Attenborough animal collecting expeditions around the world , which became the Zoo Quest series .
David Attenborough autobiography , Life on Air , was published in 2002 , revised in 2009 and is one of a number of David Attenborough works which is available as a self-narrated audiobook .
David Attenborough is the middle of three sons ( his elder brother , Richard , became an actor and his younger brother , John , an executive at Italian car manufacturer Alfa Romeo ) .

In Greek mythology , the Giants (Greek mythology) or Gigantes ( Greek : Γίγαντες , Giants (Greek mythology) ) were the children of Gaia , who was fertilized by the blood of Uranus , after Uranus was castrated by his son Cronus .
Gaia , incensed by the imprisonment of the Titans in Tartarus by the Olympians , incited Giants (Greek mythology) to rise up in arms against them , end their reign , and restore the Titans ' rule .
The Olympians fought Giants (Greek mythology) with the Moirai aiding them before the aforementioned prophecy was made , meaning Giants (Greek mythology) would have overcome the combined efforts of both Olympus and the Sisters of Fate had Heracles not fought .
This battle occurred in the time when Heracles lived , so many events had already happened : the establishment of the Olympian gods , their progeny , the adventures of Perseus ( forefather of Heracles ) and so on .
Eduard Fraenkel remarks of these lines , with their highly unusual plural Atlantes , `` It does not surprise us to find the names Titani and Gigantes employed indiscriminately to denote the same mythological creatures , for we are used to the identification , or confusion , of these two types of monsters which , though not original , had probably become fairly common by the time of Naevius '' .
According to the Greeks , Giants (Greek mythology) were buried by the gods beneath the earth , where their writhing caused volcanic activity and earthquakes .
More impressive depictions of the Gigantomachy can be found in classical sculptural relief , such as the great altar of Pergamon , where the serpent-legged giants are locked in battle with a host of gods , or in Antiquity at the Temple of Olympian Zeus at Acragas .
Giants (Greek mythology) is Alcyoneus , Ephialtes , Leon , Peloreus , Porphyrion and Theodamas .
Most existing estuaries were formed during the Holocene epoch by the flooding of river-eroded or glacially scoured valleys when the sea level began to rise about 10,000-12 ,000 years ago .
Estuary provide habitats for a large number of organisms and support very high productivity .

The Kali Gandaki Gorge in midwest Nepal is seen by others to be the deepest canyon , with a 6400 m ( 21,000 ft ) difference between the level of the river and the peaks surrounding it .
The second largest canyon , and the largest in Africa , is the Fish River Canyon in Namibia .
Copper Canyon in Chihuahua , Mexico is deeper and longer than the Grand Canyon .
Evapotranspiration ( ET ) is the sum of evaporation and plant transpiration from the Earth 's land surface to atmosphere .
Evapotranspiration is a reflection of the energy available to evaporate water , and of the wind available to transport the water vapour from the ground up into the lower atmosphere .
Conifer forests tend to have higher rates of evapotranspiration than deciduous forests , particularly in the dormant and early spring seasons .
This is primarily due to the enhanced amount of precipitation intercepted and evaporated by conifer foliage during these periods .
Trees in cloud forests collect the liquid water in fog or low clouds onto their surface , which drips down to the ground .
Other solutions used includes Makkink , which is simple but must be calibrated to a specific location , and Hargreaves .
A review of ET measurement techniques for estimating the water requirements of urban landscape vegetation could be seen Evapotranspiration ( PET ) is the amount of water that would be evaporated and transpired if there were sufficient water available .
The difference between potential evapotranspiration and precipitation is used in irrigation scheduling .
( Wye ) ( 1900 -- 1982 ) was a British organic gardener and pioneer of no dig gardening .
Megaera ( Ancient Greek : Megaera , English translation : `` the jealous one '' ) is one of the Erinyes , Eumenides or `` Furies '' in Greek mythology .
In modern French ( mégère ) , Portuguese ( megera ) , modern Greek , Italian ( megera ) and Russian , this name denotes a jealous or spiteful woman - Google translates all five as `` shrew '' .
Rock shelter ( also known as a rockhouse , crepuscular cave , or abri ) is a shallow cave-like opening at the base of a bluff or cliff .
In western Connecticut and eastern New York , many rock shelters are known by the colloquialism `` leatherman caves '' , as they were inhabited by the Leatherman over three decades in the late 19th century .
The Cumberland stitchwort ( Minuartia cumberlandensis ) is an endangered species of plant which is found only in rock shelters in Kentucky and Tennessee .
For historical reasons , many point defects , especially in ionic crystals , are called centers : for example a vacancy in many ionic solids is called a luminescence center , a color center , or F-center .
A successful mathematical classification method for physical lattice defects , which works not only with the theory of dislocations and other defects in crystals but also , e.g. , for disclinations in liquid crystals and for excitations in superfluid 3He , is the topological homotopy theory .
Several moons , such as Earth 's moon and the Galilean satellites , have exospheres without a denser atmosphere underneath .

Natural arch or natural bridge is a natural rock formation where Natural arch arch forms , with an opening underneath .
Wave refraction concentrates the wave energy on the headland , and an arch forms when caves break through the headland , e.g. , London Bridge in ( Victoria , Australia ) .
Good examples of this are at Durdle Door and Stair Hole near Lulworth Cove on the Dorset Jurassic Coast in south England , although these are on an area of concordant coastline .
Jeff Noon ( born in 1957 in Droylsden , Greater Manchester , England ) is a novelist , short story writer and Jeff Noon .
Noon 's first four novels , which share ongoing characters and settings , are commonly referred to as the ` Vurt series ' ( after the first novel ) .
( Automated Alice connects the series to the fictional world of Lewis Carroll ) , serving as a ` trequel ' to Carroll 's Alice 's Adventures in Wonderland and Through the Looking-Glass ) Vurt tells the story of Scribble and Jeff Noon `` gang '' the Stash Riders as they search for Jeff Noon missing sister Desdemona .
The people who suffer from newmonia ( pronounced the same as the real condition pneumonia ) , are hybrids of humans and other entities .
The ` Supreme Serpent ' is the controller of the serpents , and hints at the fact that Jeff Noon is Satan Jeff Noon .

Elliot 's subsequent search draws Jeff Noon into a secret history of music that stretches back forty years and into Jeff Noon own past .

Philip V ( c. 1292/1293 -- 3 January 1322 ) , the Tall , was King of France , King of Navarre , as Philip II , and Count of Champagne .
Philip was influenced both by the troubles and unrest that Philip V of France father had encountered during 1314 , and the difficulties that Philip V of France older brother -- Louis X , known as `` the Quarreler '' had faced during the intervening few years .
One theory has been that Philip V of France was concerned that if Philip V of France was to abandon Joan , Philip V of France might also lose Burgundy ; another theory suggests that Philip V of France slightly `` formulaic '' love letters to Philip V of France wife should be taken at face value , and that Philip V of France was in fact very deeply in love .
Philip remained as regent for the remainder of the pregnancy and for a few days after the birth of Philip V of France nephew John I -- the infant only lived for five days before dying .
The majority of the nobility , however , refused to attend , there were demonstrations in Champagne , Artois and Burgundy and Philip called a rapid assembly of the nobility on 2 February in Paris .
Philip laid down the principle that Joan , as a woman , could not inherit the throne of France , played heavily upon the fact that Philip V of France was now the anointed king , and consolidated what some authors have described as Philip V of France effective `` usurpation '' of power .
If the French crown was to bestow or grant new lands to nobles , Philip declared , they would usually be given only from the second source : this was a double-edged announcement , at once reinforcing the core , unalienable powers of the crown , whilst also reassuring nobles that their lands were sacrosanct unless they were forfeited to the crown in punishment for a crime or misdemeanour .
Louis had been brought up in Nevers in central France , and at Philip 's court .
Like the Count of Flanders , Edward in Philip V of France role as the ruler of Gascony owed homage to the king of France , but as a king in Philip V of France own right , and as the head of a largely autonomous Gascon province , was disinclined to do so .
Both Philip and John agreed , however , that a French crusade was impossible whilst the military situation in Flanders remained unstable .
The Shepherds ' Crusade , or the Pastoreaux , emerged out of Normandy in 1320 .
The King 's southern tour and reform plans , although administratively sound by modern standards , had created much local opposition and modern historians have linked the King 's role in Poiters with the sudden outbreak of violence .
This all put Philip in a difficult position ; Philip V of France could not openly side with those claiming wrongdoing by the lepers , Jews and Muslims without encouraging further , unnecessary violence -- on the other hand , if Philip V of France did not ally Philip V of France to the cause , Philip V of France encouraged further unsanctioned violence , weakening Philip V of France royal position .
Asteroids (video game) was one of the most popular and influential games of the Golden Age of Arcade Games , selling 70,000 arcade cabinets .
Asteroids (video game) uses a vector display and a two-dimensional view that wraps around in both screen axes .
The object of Asteroids (video game) is to shoot and destroy Asteroids (video game) Asteroids (video game) while not colliding with either , or being hit by the saucers ' counter-fire .
Asteroids (video game) is also the first game to use Atari 's `` QuadraScan '' vector-refresh system ; a full-color version known as `` Color-QuadraScan '' was later developed for games such as Space Duel and Tempest .
The objective of Asteroids (video game) is to score as many points as possible by destroying Asteroids (video game) and flying saucers .
Once the screen has been cleared of all Asteroids (video game) and flying saucers , a new set of large asteroids appears .
The hardware consists primarily of a standard MOS 6502 CPU , which executes the game program , and the Digital Vector Generator ( DVG ) , vector processing circuitry developed by Atari themselves .
As the 6502 by Asteroids (video game) was too slow to control both the game play and the vector hardware at the same time , the latter task was delegated to the DVG .
Also , a new version of Asteroids (video game) was developed for PlayStation , Nintendo 64 , Windows , and the Game Boy Color in the late 1990s .
Asteroids (video game) includes fully 3D environments , new weapons , over 50 levels , and a 2 player split-screen mode ; including a Versus mode , a Co-op mode , and a Team mode .
In 2004 , Asteroids (video game) ( Including both the Atari 2600 port and the arcade original , along with Asteroids (video game) Deluxe ) were included as part of Atari Anthology for both Xbox and PlayStation 2 , using Digital Eclipse 's emulation technology .
Asteroids (video game) is one of the most popular and influential games of the Golden Age of Arcade Games , selling 70,000 arcade cabinets .

Charles IV ( Clermont 18/19 June 1294 -- Vincennes 1 February 1328 ) , called the Fair ( French : le Bel ) was Count of Champagne , King of Navarre ( as Charles I ) and the last `` direct '' Capetian King of France from 1322 to Charles IV of France death .
Charles married again in 1325 , this time to Jeanne d'Évreux : Jeanne was Charles IV of France first cousin , and the marriage required approval from Pope John XXII .
The ceremony represented a combination of a political statement , social event and an `` expensive fashion statement '' ; the cost of food , furs , velvets and jewellery for Charles ' event in 1326 was so expensive that negotiations over the cost were still ongoing in 1329 .
Charles relied heavily during the first half of Charles IV of France reign on Charles IV of France uncle , Charles of Valois , for advice and to undertake key military tasks .
Charles ' father , Philip IV , had confiscated the estates of numerous Jews in 1306 , and Charles IV of France took vigorous , but unpopular , steps to call in Christian debts to these accounts .
Charles IV of France inherited a long running period of tension between England and Charles IV of France .
Edward II of England , as Duke of Aquitaine , owed homage to the King of Charles IV of France ; Edward had successfully avoided paying homage under Charles ' older brother Louis X , and had only paid homage to Philip V under great pressure .
One of the elements in the disputes was the border province of Agenais , part of Gascony and in turn part of Aquitaine .
Charles had sent a message through Pope John XXII to Edward , suggesting that Charles IV of France was willing to reverse the forfeiture of the lands if Edward ceded the Agenais and paid homage for the rest of the lands : the Pope in turn had proposed Isabella as an ambassador .
Charles met with Isabella , and was said to have welcomed her to France ; Isabella was joined by the young Prince Edward later that year , who paid homage to Charles on Charles IV of France father 's behalf as a peace gesture .
Over time , however , Louis ' clear French loyalties and lack of political links within Flanders itself began to erode Charles IV of France position within the county itself .
Despite having massed forces along the border , Charles ' military attentions were distracted by the problems in Gascony and Charles IV of France eventually chose to settle the rebellion peacefully through the Peace of Arques in 1326 , in which Louis was only indirectly involved .
Charles gave Charles IV of France nephew a particularly advanced education by the standards of the day , arranged for Charles IV of France marriage to Blanche of Valois and also bestowed Charles IV of France name upon Václav .
Charles IV of France father , Philip IV , had committed France to a fresh crusade and Charles IV of France brother , Philip V , had brought plans for a fresh invasion close to execution in 1320 , their cancellation resulting in the informal and chaotic Shepherds ' Crusade .
Andronicus II responded by sending an envoy to Paris in 1327 , proposing peace and discussions on ecclesiastical union -- a French envoy sent in return with Pope John 's blessing later in the year , however , found Byzantium beset with civil war and negotiations floundered .
This allowed the kings of the various cities to accumulate wealth and power .
There is however some evidence that the area had been occupied long before the alleged arrival of Mycenaeans ( at Enkomi ) and the town of Salamis, Cyprus was developed as a replacement when Engkomi was isolated from the sea .
Under King Evagoras ( 411-374 BCE ) Greek culture and art flourished in the city and Salamis, Cyprus would be interesting one day when the spade of the archaeologist uncovers public buildings of this period .
Marguerite Yon ( archaeologist ) claims that `` Literary texts and inscriptions suggest that by the Classical period , Kition in present-day Larnaca was one of the principal local powers , along with Salamis, Cyprus neighbor Salamis '' .
In 306 BCE , Salamis, Cyprus was the site of a naval battle between the fleets of Demetrius I of Macedon and Ptolemy I of Egypt .
One royal tomb contained a large amount of Greek Geometric pottery and this has been explained as the dowry of a Greek princess who married into the royal family of Salamis, Cyprus .
At this time the Greeks were embarking on an eastward expansion by founding colonies in Asia Minor and Syria ; Salamis, Cyprus must have served as an intermediate station ; it has even been suggested that Cypriots helped the Greeks in their venture .

Many Rarámuri reside in the cooler , mountainous regions during the hot summer months and migrate deeper into the canyons in the cooler winter months , where the climate is more temperate .
The Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty ( Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty ) bans all nuclear explosions in all environments , for military or civilian purposes .
These `` Annex 2 states '' are states that participated in Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty negotiations between 1994 and 1996 and possessed nuclear power reactors or research reactors at that time .
Over 50 nuclear explosions were registered between 16 July 1945 , when the first nuclear explosive test was conducted by the United States at White Sands Missile Range near Alamogordo , New Mexico , and 31 December 1953 .
Under the direction of Prime Minister John Howard and Foreign Minister Alexander Downer , Australia then sent the text to the United Nations General Assembly in New York , where it was submitted as a draft resolution .
India and Pakistan both carried out two sets of tests in 1998 .
The Preparatory Commission for the Comprehensive Test Ban Treaty Organization ( CTBTO ) , an international organization headquartered in Vienna , Austria , was created to build the verification regime , including establishment and provisional operation of the network of monitoring stations , the creation of an international data centre , and development of the On Site Inspection capability .
Compounds with atoms other than carbon and fluorine are not true fluorocarbons and Fluorocarbon are considered as fluorocarbon derivatives in a separate section below .
Additionally , multiple carbon -- fluorine bonds increase the strength and stability of other nearby carbon -- fluorine bonds on the same geminal carbon , as Fluorocarbon has a higher positive partial charge .
The so-called `` catalytic '' method involved reacting fluorine and hydrocarbon on a bed of gold-plated copper turnings , the metal removing the heat of the reaction ( so not really acting as a catalyst at all ) , allowing larger hydrocarbons to survive the process .
C6H14 + 28 CoF3 → C6F14 + 14 HF + 28 CoF2 Industrially , both steps are combined , for example in the manufacture of the Flutec range of fluorocarbons , using a vertical stirred bed reactor , with hydrocarbon introduced at the bottom , and fluorine introduced half way up the reactor .
Many geomorphologists are particularly interested in the potential for feedbacks between climate and tectonics mediated by Geomorphology processes .
Because geomorphology is defined to comprise everything related to the surface of Earth and Geomorphology modification , Geomorphology is a broad field with many facets .
While Penck and Davis and their followers were writing and studying primarily in Western Europe , another , largely separate , school of geomorphology was developed in the United States in the middle years of the 20th century .
Modern advances in geochronology , in particular cosmogenic radionuclide dating , optically stimulated luminescence dating and low-temperature thermochronology have enabled us for the first time to measure the rates at which Geomorphology processes occur on geological timescales .
At the same time , the use of more precise physical measurement techniques , including differential GPS , remotely sensed digital terrain models and laser scanning techniques , have allowed quantification and study of these processes as Geomorphology happen .
The water , as Geomorphology flows over the channel bed , is able to mobilize sediment and transport Geomorphology downstream , either as bed load , suspended load or dissolved load .
The way glacial processes interact with other landscape elements , particularly hillslope and fluvial processes , is an important aspect of Plio-Pleistocene landscape evolution and Geomorphology sedimentary record in many high mountain environments .
In Greek mythology , the Aloadae ( or Aloadai ; ) were Otus and Ephialtes , sons of Iphimedia , wife of Aloeus , by Poseidon , whom she induced to make her pregnant by going to the seashore and disporting herself in the surf or scooping seawater into her bosom .
Nevertheless , Ephialtes of Trachis argues Ephialtes was the one who revealed this trail because `` the deputies of the Greeks , the Pylagorae , who must have had the best means for ascertaining the truth , did not offer the reward on the heads of Onetas and Corydallus , but for that of Ephialtes of Trachis '' .
The news reached the Greeks at Thermopylae either late that day or before the dawn of the next day , who held a council to decide their next step .
Frank Miller 's 1998 comic book miniseries 300 , and the 2006 film adaptation of the same name , portray Ephialtes as a severely deformed Spartan in exile who betrays the Spartan army after Leonidas , although sympathetic towards Ephialtes of Trachis , denies Ephialtes of Trachis the right to fight because Ephialtes of Trachis was unable to lift a shield high enough , thus compromising the integrity of the phalanx formation .
Local Exchange Trading Systems is a fully fledged monetary or exchange system , unlike direct barter .
For example in Australia , Peter Baldwin , a former Minister of Social Security in the Keating government , encouraged Local Exchange Trading Systems as a way of letting welfare recipients borrow against their welfare entitlement for urgent personal needs or to establish themselves in business .
Aeolus was outraged and compelled Canace to commit suicide as punishment , sending her a sword with which she was to stab herself .
The adjustable loop forms of the rolling hitch and Magnus hitch , in addition to being called either of those two names , have also come to be known variously as Taut-line hitch , tent-line hitch , rigger 's hitch , adjustable hitch , or midshipman 's hitch .
In Greek mythology , Enarete or Aenarete ( , Ainarete ) , daughter of Deimachus , was the wife of Aeolus and ancestress of the Aeolians .
Poseidon , in the guise of a kingfisher , seduced Alope , his granddaughter through Cercyon , and from the union she gave birth to Hippothoon .
Cercyon is also the name of the son of Agamedes , and the father of Hippothous , who succeeded Agapenor as king of Arcadia when he did not return from Troy .
